subject: Don't delete container_cidr key when overriding
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-13 17:23:19.000000000', 'files': ['lib/generate.py', 'tests/test_inventory.py', 'releasenotes/notes/container_cidr_key_restored-4d232fff46ec00b9.yaml'], 'message': "Don't delete container_cidr key when overriding

Commit f426eb98d1e4dc0b8b65f9191b038edcea849755 added a global_override
deletion mechanism, but did not account for the automatically-created
container_cidr key.

This change ensures the key is skipped in deletion, and adds further
tests for the _parse_gloabl_variables function.

Change-Id: I5c48adea5920c1524be75939a75af6bed3a9743a
Closes-Bug: #1649632
"}]
commit_message:
Don't delete container_cidr key when overriding

Commit f426eb98d1e4dc0b8b65f9191b038edcea849755 added a global_override
deletion mechanism, but did not account for the automatically-created
container_cidr key.

This change ensures the key is skipped in deletion, and adds further
tests for the _parse_gloabl_variables function.

Change-Id: I5c48adea5920c1524be75939a75af6bed3a9743a
Closes-Bug: #1649632

commit_message:
Add ldlinux.c32 to the tftp directory

This patch adds a task to copy ldlinux.c32 to the tftp directory
when on ubuntu 16.04. Also, changed the copy tasks to a unique
task making use of the copy module with 'remote_src: True'.

Change-Id: I4a71c198ad11d293e15f8a80bc1dcd0c6e6aa479

commit_message:
Fixing bug on syntribos init

The latest change introduced a bug to syntribos init. It crashed on
line 282 when CONF.config_file and CONF.config_dir returns list but
str expected. This patch fixes it.

Closes-Bug: 1648562

Change-Id: Ib83dd03a500613843abadc5dcbfd9a9c477f8503

commit_message:
Fix syntax in JS, JSON indent with 4 spaces

template.html
- Fix syntax:
    + Add a lot of semi-colons after statements/function expressions
    + Add a lot of brackets in for/if section
- Change bracket notation -> dot notation (prefered in JS)
- Change case in CSS colors
- Change double quote to single quote
- Add closing span tag

commands.py
- Indent json with 4 spaces

Implements: blueprint update-html-template

Change-Id: Idad248c3b3f9570045efb1495b69614a60e3f733

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-12-09 05:11:30.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Restrict nova-network jobs for ec2 and gce gating jobs

Restrict nova-network jobs to previous to Ocata releases.
Due to EOL of nova-network service from Ocata release
in common environment gating of gce-api and ec2-api
against nova-network can be implemented only with nova
cells v1. but cells v1 is about to be deprecated soon too.

Change-Id: I9960be3fa031212c9c70bbf3aed434709d787e8d
'}]
commit_message:
Restrict nova-network jobs for ec2 and gce gating jobs

Restrict nova-network jobs to previous to Ocata releases.
Due to EOL of nova-network service from Ocata release
in common environment gating of gce-api and ec2-api
against nova-network can be implemented only with nova
cells v1. but cells v1 is about to be deprecated soon too.

Change-Id: I9960be3fa031212c9c70bbf3aed434709d787e8d

commit_message:
Add workaround step to avoid introspection failure

This error seems to be environment/workflow specific.
The workaround was added as the error is not
reproducible in other environments - and those
not using ironic node-update.
Related-Bug: #1649350

Change-Id: Ib47be90d4cba72cc88b5d9a1ac702279354b27ff

commit_message:
Add mandatory option for validating the json input

This patch adds mandatory option, which checks if a given
parameter is mandatory or not, if the mandatory parameter
is not specified in JSON input to REST API, then it raises
exception.

Closes-Bug: #1634780
Change-Id: I54987580d49f7d0fb1230177a28d32f49564da6c

revisions:

When an exception was caught and rethrown, it should

commit_message:
Correct reraising of exception

When an exception was caught and rethrown, it should
call 'raise' without any arguments because it shows
the place where an exception occured initially instead
of place where the exception re-raised

Change-Id: Ia5621c1c56fb9e2fc22dc792ddb1a36862fcd49b

commit_message:
Revert "Revert "Show team and repo badges on README""

The issue was a new docutils release that is more strict about
remote images. This reverted revert includes the fix[1] squashed
in, otherwise it would not be mergable.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/409209/

subject: Make git clone process idempotent
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-13 17:59:28.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test-install-server.yml', 'tasks/repo_clone_git.yml', 'templates/op-clone-script.sh.j2'], 'message': "Make git clone process idempotent

This patch makes the git clone process idempotent.

Using asynchronous Ansible tasks to achieve the goal
also resolves a race condition seen when using the
selective git clone process with a small number of
git sources.

Ansible handles the asynchronous tasks better than
the bash job control 'wait' command.

The test to validate that a missing 'origin' remote
does not break the git clone process was removed due
to https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/19290

Closes-Bug: #1649329
Change-Id: I3e68f155190461470adb7e46d904705d991973af
(cherry picked from commit da7b0e120eec66903833aa6331522b536044620e)
"}]
commit_message:
Make git clone process idempotent

This patch makes the git clone process idempotent.

Using asynchronous Ansible tasks to achieve the goal
also resolves a race condition seen when using the
selective git clone process with a small number of
git sources.

Ansible handles the asynchronous tasks better than
the bash job control 'wait' command.

The test to validate that a missing 'origin' remote
does not break the git clone process was removed due
to https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/19290

Closes-Bug: #1649329
Change-Id: I3e68f155190461470adb7e46d904705d991973af
(cherry picked from commit da7b0e120eec66903833aa6331522b536044620e)

commit_message:
[WIP] Allow logical name along with UUID in port creation

Currently a port can be created via a POST /v1/ports, with 'node_uuid' and
'address' specified in the body. Now that we have logical names, we should
allow the port creation to accept the name of the node instead of the UUID of
the node. E.g. In request body pass "node_name" instead of "node_uuid"

Change-Id: I531001483c1b592a63ba5a9283f8e37ca07fdc69

commit_message:
Enable Memcache service for Token Caching

With the release of 4.2.0 of keystonemiddleware using the
in-process token cache is no longer recommended. It is recommended
that a memcache backend to store tokens is used instead,

This installs and configures memcache and configures ceilometer agent
to use memcache for token caching.

http://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/keystonemiddleware/mitaka.html#id2

Change-Id: If7dd4c5472a7842f06d0fd44c1b2012c9c9d1075

commit_message:
Make git clone process idempotent

This patch makes the git clone process idempotent.

Using asynchronous Ansible tasks to achieve the goal
also resolves a race condition seen when using the
selective git clone process with a small number of
git sources.

Ansible handles the asynchronous tasks better than
the bash job control 'wait' command.

The test to validate that a missing 'origin' remote
does not break the git clone process was removed due
to https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/19290

Closes-Bug: #1649329
Change-Id: I3e68f155190461470adb7e46d904705d991973af

subject: Use base.create_volume in VolumesTestJSON
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-12 09:21:23.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/volumes/test_volumes_list.py', 'tempest/api/compute/base.py'], 'message': 'Use base.create_volume in VolumesTestJSON

In VolumesTestJSON.resource_setup,
1) the multi lines of creating volumes can be replaced by one call
   to base.create_volume.(base.create_volume can be modified to
   accept other kwargs)
2) The try...except seems no necessary, because if not all volumes are
   created, the volumes already created will be deleted automatically.
   And without LOG.exception(exc), we can also clearly see the traceback
   info to see what had happened.
3) the resource_cleanup is no necessary, because volumes created by
   base.create_volume can be deleted automatically.

This patch is to deal with these points and to make code more simple.

Change-Id: Ia0bf536882776717521a86107a9b72ced9408398
'}]
commit_message:
Use base.create_volume in VolumesTestJSON

In VolumesTestJSON.resource_setup,
1) the multi lines of creating volumes can be replaced by one call
   to base.create_volume.(base.create_volume can be modified to
   accept other kwargs)
2) The try...except seems no necessary, because if not all volumes are
   created, the volumes already created will be deleted automatically.
   And without LOG.exception(exc), we can also clearly see the traceback
   info to see what had happened.
3) the resource_cleanup is no necessary, because volumes created by
   base.create_volume can be deleted automatically.

This patch is to deal with these points and to make code more simple.

Change-Id: Ia0bf536882776717521a86107a9b72ced9408398

subject: Replace six.iteritems() with .items()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-09 02:29:55.000000000', 'files': ['solumclient/common/cliutils.py', 'solumclient/tests/common/test_exc.py', 'solumclient/common/apiclient/auth.py', 'solumclient/v1/plan.py', 'solumclient/common/apiclient/base.py', 'solumclient/common/apiclient/exceptions.py'], 'message': 'Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can
use dict.items instead, as it will return
iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys
will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance
about list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: Ic4fe5a3badfda93af11683215f0dad9b886e4791
'}]
commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can
use dict.items instead, as it will return
iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys
will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance
about list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: Ic4fe5a3badfda93af11683215f0dad9b886e4791

subject: refactor existing implementation into a class
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-09 23:01:01.000000000', 'files': ['reno/tests/test_cache.py', 'reno/cache.py', 'reno/scanner.py', 'reno/tests/test_scanner.py', 'reno/loader.py'], 'message': 'refactor existing implementation into a class

As part of the re-implementation work using dulwich I want to create a
Scanner class, to replace some of the module-level functions in the
scanner module now. This patch moves existing code around into something
like what I would expect that API to look like, without changing the
implementation details.

The class API is still subject to change in the future, but this should
make it a little easier to review those implementation changes.

Change-Id: If92f6ff5bce955bbdcb748cee52ad71210ae313b
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
refactor existing implementation into a class

As part of the re-implementation work using dulwich I want to create a
Scanner class, to replace some of the module-level functions in the
scanner module now. This patch moves existing code around into something
like what I would expect that API to look like, without changing the
implementation details.

The class API is still subject to change in the future, but this should
make it a little easier to review those implementation changes.

Change-Id: If92f6ff5bce955bbdcb748cee52ad71210ae313b
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

The enabled/ directory allows toggling of panels and plugins

commit_message:
Moves OPENSTACK_MANILA_SETTINGS TO local_settings.d/

The enabled/ directory allows toggling of panels and plugins
while the local_settings.d/ allows overriding of settings.
We had OPENSTACK_MANILA_SETTINGS dict under enabled/ and for this
reason the settings overriden there were not taking effect.
This patch set moves OPENSTACK_MANILA_SETTINGS under local_settings.d/

Change-Id: Ie4cd49216f1a4a93c5fe1358c97682f8e4044b43
Closes-Bug: #1641624

commit_message:
Update apt after proxy config is dropped

Added an apt update after the apt proxy configuration file is
dropped. The error that was seen is that certain packages could
not be authenticated. Updating apt after the proxy is configure
solves the issue.

Change-Id: Ib971231f81442b74868e692d7d47b1ce827e9c7d
Closes-Bug: #1649416

Added default node filter

If graph does not contain node_filter the default filter
will be used. this will help to improve UX when user works
with graph concept.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-12 20:53:33.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/source/unreleased.rst'], 'message': "tell reno not to scan the entire master branch

Reno will scan an entire branch by default. This isn't useful on the
master branch, where we only want to show unreleased changes. This
change sets the earliest-version to include on that branch to the point
where the stable/newton branch was created.

NOTE: It's not necessary to update this every cycle, but keeping it up
to date will shorten the build time.

Change-Id: I299e3f9ba2e318cd3ed078897b7c980b724b4fb6
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
"}]
commit_message:
tell reno not to scan the entire master branch

Reno will scan an entire branch by default. This isn't useful on the
master branch, where we only want to show unreleased changes. This
change sets the earliest-version to include on that branch to the point
where the stable/newton branch was created.

NOTE: It's not necessary to update this every cycle, but keeping it up
to date will shorten the build time.

Change-Id: I299e3f9ba2e318cd3ed078897b7c980b724b4fb6
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Enable Memcache service for Token Caching
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-12-13 09:26:52.000000000', 'files': ['hooks/charmhelpers/contrib/openstack/templates/section-keystone-authtoken-mitaka', 'unit_tests/test_heat_utils.py', 'hooks/heat_utils.py', 'hooks/charmhelpers/contrib/openstack/utils.py', 'tests/charmhelpers/contrib/amulet/utils.py', 'tests/charmhelpers/contrib/openstack/amulet/utils.py', 'tests/basic_deployment.py', 'hooks/charmhelpers/contrib/openstack/context.py', 'hooks/charmhelpers/contrib/openstack/amulet/utils.py', 'hooks/charmhelpers/contrib/openstack/templates/memcached.conf'], 'message': 'Enable Memcache service for Token Caching

With the release of 4.2.0 of keystonemiddleware using the
in-process token cache is no longer recommended. It is recommended
that a memcache backend to store tokens is used instead,

This installs and configures memcache and configures neutron-server
to use memcache for token caching.

http://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/keystonemiddleware/mitaka.html#id2

Change-Id: Ic921a7efbd860cbcd4da2313126f73d7bdfdb4ed
'}]
commit_message:
Enable Memcache service for Token Caching

With the release of 4.2.0 of keystonemiddleware using the
in-process token cache is no longer recommended. It is recommended
that a memcache backend to store tokens is used instead,

This installs and configures memcache and configures neutron-server
to use memcache for token caching.

commit_message:
Enable Memcache service for Token Caching

With the release of 4.2.0 of keystonemiddleware using the
in-process token cache is no longer recommended. It is recommended
that a memcache backend to store tokens is used instead,

This installs and configures memcache and configures neutron-server
to use memcache for token caching.

http://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/keystonemiddleware/mitaka.html#id2

Change-Id: I259c9a12b1ac1d0fa8adedb6ef5b6645f976d167

commit_message:
Enable Memcache service for Token Caching

With the release of 4.2.0 of keystonemiddleware using the
in-process token cache is no longer recommended. It is recommended
that a memcache backend to store tokens is used instead,

This installs and configures memcache and configures neutron-server
to use memcache for token caching.

http://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/keystonemiddleware/mitaka.html#id2

commit_message:
Create two new clients under tempest.lib libary

There are two API v2 actions that only admin has the permission to excute,
according to:
http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-blockstorage-v2.html#listPools
http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-blockstorage-v2.html#showBackendCapabilities

Currently, those actions reside on BaseVolumesClient class and I think we
should separate them to new files: tempest/lib/services/volume/v2/capabilities_client.py
                                   tempest/lib/services/volume/v2/scheduler_stats_client.py

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I48e5e19331dd636a093e1817e5c2ea31534ae2c3

commit_message:
Py3: Make test_manager py3 compatable

Fixes: NameError: name 'file' is not defined
file() is removed in python3.x using open()
 will solve it.
Fixes: AttributeError: 'generator' object has no
attribute 'next'
Python3 it is __next__()

Change-Id: Ib2cbdfbbedb86f6e01239d2ee991677727b0548b

subject: Consolidate node last_error processing
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'Flying to the moon with a Jetpack!'}, {'_account_id': 16628, 'name': 'Beth Elwell', 'email': 'e.r.elwell@gmail.com', 'username': 'bethelwell'}, {'_account_id': 19380, 'name': 'Peter Piela', 'email': 'ppiela@gmail.com', 'username': 'ppiela'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-12-06 23:19:36.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_ui/static/dashboard/admin/ironic/node-list/node-list.controller.js', 'ironic_ui/static/dashboard/admin/ironic/ironic.service.js', 'ironic_ui/static/dashboard/admin/ironic/node-error.service.js', 'ironic_ui/static/dashboard/admin/ironic/node-details/node-details.controller.js'], 'message': 'Consolidate node last_error processing

Consolidate last_error processing for the node-list and node-detail
views using a newly added node-error service. The service provides
a function checkNodeError that will compare the error condition
of a specified node with its last known value which is stored
in browser session persistent storage (as part of each check).
If a change in the node error condition has occurred the user
is notified using the toast service. The use of persistent storage
eliminates duplicate notifications that would otherwise be
generated from page transitions and service re-initializations.

The checkNodeError function is called whenever node information
is retrieved using the ironic service getNode/getNodes functions.

Change-Id: Iba7bdaaa78d51384b6b9d79d2d723b8e7607eb9a
'}]
commit_message:
Consolidate node last_error processing

Consolidate last_error processing for the node-list and node-detail
views using a newly added node-error service. The service provides
a function checkNodeError that will compare the error condition
of a specified node with its last known value which is stored
in browser session persistent storage (as part of each check).
If a change in the node error condition has occurred the user
is notified using the toast service. The use of persistent storage
eliminates duplicate notifications that would otherwise be
generated from page transitions and service re-initializations.

The checkNodeError function is called whenever node information
is retrieved using the ironic service getNode/getNodes functions.

Change-Id: Iba7bdaaa78d51384b6b9d79d2d723b8e7607eb9a

subject: Revert "Add hypervisor inspector sanity check"
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-13 13:26:09.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/compute/virt/inspector.py', 'ceilometer/compute/virt/libvirt/inspector.py', 'ceilometer/compute/pollsters/__init__.py', 'ceilometer/tests/unit/compute/virt/libvirt/test_inspector.py', 'ceilometer/tests/unit/agent/test_manager.py'], 'message': 'Revert "Add hypervisor inspector sanity check"

This change have introduced an issue, when the libvirt unix socket
is created after Ceilometer start. The pollster is disabled when
it should wait that libvirt come up.

The intent of the original bug was only to have a cosmetic logs
when the configuration file is wrong.

Also I don't see a safe way to disable the pollster when we can't
connect to libvirt, the reason is always unknown from Ceilometer PoV.

This reverts commit d17e75d2675c1acf09adc27249b1e968450c5229.

Change-Id: I63479d19fcf4a99fb198859c2e6ae370ff0e24e1
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Add hypervisor inspector sanity check"

This change have introduced an issue, when the libvirt unix socket
is created after Ceilometer start. The pollster is disabled when
it should wait that libvirt come up.

The intent of the original bug was only to have a cosmetic logs
when the configuration file is wrong.

Also I don't see a safe way to disable the pollster when we can't
connect to libvirt, the reason is always unknown from Ceilometer PoV.

This reverts commit d17e75d2675c1acf09adc27249b1e968450c5229.

Change-Id: I63479d19fcf4a99fb198859c2e6ae370ff0e24e1

drop disable_non_metric_meters option

remain are on purpose and should be disabled via pipeline.

commit_message:
Make shade magnum job non-voting

Volume backups are failing when magnum is enabled. While we figure that
out, turn the magnum job into a non-voting job.

commit_message:
shade-keystone2 job does not have designate

The missing-services test works! Except we told it that the keystone job
has designate and it doesn't. Also, remove the plugin references since
they don't work with this config.

commit_message:
Specific exception for stale cluster state was added.

Specific exception should be thrown when cluster state
is stale. Current usage is to raise this exception if
compute_model.state is True.
Bug was describeid by Jean-Emile DARTOIS.

Change-Id: Iaddb4cc8007c51bb14759c9da829751e834499d0
Closes-Bug: #1621855

subject: Create nova_api db during the controller upgrade
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-12-08 23:03:13.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/tasks/liberty_to_mitaka_nova_api_upgrade.pp', 'extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_pacemaker.yaml'], 'message': "Create nova_api db during the controller upgrade

For liberty to mitaka upgrade, we need to create the
nova api database during the controller upgrade to avoid
interruption of the compute services before the converge.
Once the compute nodes are updated, any action on the nova
instance is impossible because the api_db isn't create it
(created during the converge step)

Change-Id: I7ef4d16173d34f00c8d10d0e414da960094cb4ae
Closes-Bug: #1648504
"}]
commit_message:
Create nova_api db during the controller upgrade

For liberty to mitaka upgrade, we need to create the
nova api database during the controller upgrade to avoid
interruption of the compute services before the converge.
Once the compute nodes are updated, any action on the nova
instance is impossible because the api_db isn't create it
(created during the converge step)

Change-Id: I7ef4d16173d34f00c8d10d0e414da960094cb4ae
Closes-Bug: #1648504

subject: Replace six.iteritems() with .items()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-12 05:51:11.000000000', 'files': ['muranopkgcheck/validators/base.py', 'muranopkgcheck/checkers/code_structure.py', 'muranopkgcheck/validators/ui.py', 'muranopkgcheck/validators/muranopl.py', 'muranopkgcheck/validators/manifest.py'], 'message': 'Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can use
dict.items instead, as it will return iterators
in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more readable.
2.In py2, the performance about list should be negligible,
see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I6368133635a1f56bc923e633be683bcdda36eeb3
'}]
commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can use
dict.items instead, as it will return iterators
in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more readable.
2.In py2, the performance about list should be negligible,
see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I6368133635a1f56bc923e633be683bcdda36eeb3

subject: Use valid uuid when creating a network
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-13 15:02:13.000000000', 'files': ['networking_l2gw/tests/unit/db/test_l2gw_db.py'], 'message': 'Use valid uuid when creating a network

Recent changes in neutron (I20b24ee57c521b1c68977c2ff7ae56b56875dd64)
ensures uuid db fields are being validated, this breaks l2gw unittest on
depended repos (e.g - vmware_nsx), as there are occurence of non-valid
network-id uuid field in test_l2gw:L2GWTestCase._get_nw_data.

Change-Id: If2b41b7274e381723a1b178299aaaf63505a80d5
'}]
commit_message:
Use valid uuid when creating a network

Recent changes in neutron (I20b24ee57c521b1c68977c2ff7ae56b56875dd64)
ensures uuid db fields are being validated, this breaks l2gw unittest on
depended repos (e.g - vmware_nsx), as there are occurence of non-valid
network-id uuid field in test_l2gw:L2GWTestCase._get_nw_data.

Change-Id: If2b41b7274e381723a1b178299aaaf63505a80d5

commit_message:
Fix instructions for running simple_cell_setup

Change ff6b9998bb977421a5cbc94878ced8542d910c9e enforces in
a database migration that you've run the simple_cell_setup
command for cells v2 but the instructions in the error and
in the release note said to use 'nova-manage db' when it should
be 'nova-manage cell_v2'.

Change-Id: I8e71d1c7022d1000f26b7c16ed1c56f6e87ab8ac
Closes-Bug: #1649341

commit_message:
Remove Ironic from Tempest

In the Liberty dev cycle we agreed on the scope of Tempest ([1]).
This means that we should remove Baremetal tests from Tempest. Ironic
already has a Tempest plugin [2] so they should be able to have a
smooth transition.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/tempest/test-removal.html#tempest-scope
[2] https://github.com/openstack/ironic/tree/master/ironic_tempest_plugin
Change-Id: I9be790e3c9d47b54bd2a25bbc891215b292aaf0e

Testing has already been removed for Trusty in the integrated build and

Implements: blueprint trusty-removal

commit_message:
Remove Trusty support from os_ceilometer role

As a part of removing Trusty from OpenStack-Ansible we shall aim to
remove this from all the roles.

Testing has already been removed for Trusty in the integrated build and
all individual repositories on master (Ocata), as such we can now go
ahead and remove the support within the roles.

Change-Id: Ia564599a02eeafecc5614271fe4afbb1eb812aea
Implements: blueprint trusty-removal

subject: Skip docutils version 13.1
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-12 12:08:53.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt', 'README.rst'], 'message': 'Skip docutils version 13.1

docutils version 13.1 is causing issues with remote images. At first,
we added :remote: for each image, however, that caused the images to not
appear.
We will be skipping version 13.1, until the docutils bug [1] will be
resolved.

[1] https://sourceforge.net/p/docutils/bugs/301/

Change-Id: I50f27978ec6748754e78bec5d1d35786b210cdeb
'}]
commit_message:
Skip docutils version 13.1

docutils version 13.1 is causing issues with remote images. At first,
we added :remote: for each image, however, that caused the images to not
appear.
We will be skipping version 13.1, until the docutils bug [1] will be
resolved.

[1] https://sourceforge.net/p/docutils/bugs/301/

Change-Id: I50f27978ec6748754e78bec5d1d35786b210cdeb

commit_message:
os-vif: add new port profiles to enable fast path vhostuser

The 6WIND fast path technology provides connectivity for
vhostuser ports in traditional networks (including ovs,
linuxbridge, calico).

This patch defines new port profiles to model fast path vhostuser
vifs in order to provide os-vif plugin with enough information
for plug/unplug ports.

Signed-off-by: Francesco Santoro <francesco.santoro@6wind.com>

Change-Id: Ibae8e2ae145b2b9ad2b4955825638dee9b56f0aa

commit_message:
Make tox tests use the ansible 1.9.x version of plugins

Cloning the master version of openstack-ansible-plugins results in
attempts to use features only found in ansible 2.x.x and onwards.
This patch causes stable/mitaka to clone the stable/mitaka version
of openstack-ansible-plugins which are 1.9.x compatible.

Change-Id: I80f1b6ae2678afcff687e397f6cdf0429ae94d6a

commit_message:
Replace tempest logging module with oslo_log

Tempest removed the oslo-incubator logging module from their
code base in March 2015. Our tempest tests were still using it,
which was causing import errors.

commit_message:
Don't rely on lsb_release for hosts template write

This is problematic for the containerised heat-agents, lsb_release has
to be bind-mounted in, and atomic host doesn't even have lsb_release
installed.

Instead just write to every /etc/cloud/templates/hosts.*.tmpl file.

Change-Id: If2aab7e9b1e03aa657baf1c33aa4392ef7044075

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 4571, 'name': 'Steve Baker', 'email': 'sbaker@redhat.com', 'username': 'steve-stevebaker'}, {'_account_id': 6159, 'name': 'Flavio Percoco Premoli', 'display_name': 'flaper87', 'email': 'flavio.percoco@flyrlabs.com', 'username': 'flaper87'}, {'_account_id': 8042, 'name': 'Jiří Stránský', 'email': 'jistr@redhat.com', 'username': 'jistr'}, {'_account_id': 12398, 'name': 'Dan Sneddon', 'email': 'dsneddon@redhat.com', 'username': 'dsneddon'}, {'_account_id': 13039, 'name': 'Martin André', 'email': 'm.andre@redhat.com', 'username': 'mandre'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-12-08 20:55:48.000000000', 'files': ['docker/post.j2.yaml', 'docker/firstboot/start_docker_agents.sh'], 'message': "docker: don't use custom run-os-net-config

The script run-os-net-config[1] copies in ifcfg-* from the host before
running os-net-config. Apparently it was done this way because the
other scripts in /etc/sysconfig/network-scripts/ differed between host
and agent container. This should be less of an issue now that host and
heat-agents run centos-7 (even when the host is atomic)

tripleo-heat-templates recently changed to running os-net-config in a
deployment script instead of an os-refresh-config script [2]. This
means that our current run-os-net-config approach is currently
resulting in os-net-config being executed twice.

Another issue with run-os-net-config is that it copies ifcfg-* from
host to container, but not back again. This means that rebooting the
server will result in unconfigured interfaces until os-net-config is
somehow run again.

This change bind mounts /etc/sysconfig/network-scripts/ from the host
and uses the conventional approach to running os-refresh-config.

This may fix the issue where compute nodes are losing network
connectivity, so
Closes-Bug: #1646897

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tripleo-common/tree/heat_docker_agent/run-os-net-config
[2] I0ed08332cfc49a579de2e83960f0d8047690b97a

Change-Id: I763fc8d8e3eb10ac64d33e46c92888d211003e72
"}]
commit_message:
docker: don't use custom run-os-net-config

The script run-os-net-config[1] copies in ifcfg-* from the host before
running os-net-config. Apparently it was done this way because the
other scripts in /etc/sysconfig/network-scripts/ differed between host
and agent container. This should be less of an issue now that host and
heat-agents run centos-7 (even when the host is atomic)

tripleo-heat-templates recently changed to running os-net-config in a
deployment script instead of an os-refresh-config script [2]. This
means that our current run-os-net-config approach is currently
resulting in os-net-config being executed twice.

Another issue with run-os-net-config is that it copies ifcfg-* from
host to container, but not back again. This means that rebooting the
server will result in unconfigured interfaces until os-net-config is
somehow run again.

This change bind mounts /etc/sysconfig/network-scripts/ from the host
and uses the conventional approach to running os-refresh-config.

This may fix the issue where compute nodes are losing network
connectivity, so
Closes-Bug: #1646897

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tripleo-common/tree/heat_docker_agent/run-os-net-config
[2] I0ed08332cfc49a579de2e83960f0d8047690b97a

Change-Id: I763fc8d8e3eb10ac64d33e46c92888d211003e72

commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

We should avoid using six.iteritems/keys achieve iterators. We can use
dict.items/keys instead, as it will return iterators in PY3 as well.
And dict.items/keys will more readable.

In py2, the performance about list should be negligible, see
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3 and
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: Ibb7d5953ad22630a98e49b452d7b772ff16b64c0

commit_message:
Fix oslo.vmware lazy loading

Since we load all configuration opts at startup, all ceilometer files
are loaded. But some of them have optional dependency, like the vmware
inspector.

This change lazy load oslo.vmware like we do for libvirt.

Closes-bug: #1646871

Change-Id: Iaf51101bbaa5eba49f78e950152095913951430e

subject: Spec review: additional note on when to +2
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-06 14:31:04.000000000', 'files': ['specs/policy/spec-review.rst'], 'message': "Spec review: additional note on when to +2

There was a question during the Nov 29 weekly meeting [1] about when is
it ok to +2 a spec, when the other parts do not relate to one's area of
expertise but also to others. This includes the answer proposed into
the policy.

Also, change 'devtest' to 'undercloud install' to reflect the tooling
update.

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/tripleo/2016/tripleo.2016-11-29-14.00.log.html

Change-Id: I12c4cdd6c61188a570b8d891d30af36bac794157
"}]
commit_message:
Spec review: additional note on when to +2

There was a question during the Nov 29 weekly meeting [1] about when is
it ok to +2 a spec, when the other parts do not relate to one's area of
expertise but also to others. This includes the answer proposed into
the policy.

Also, change 'devtest' to 'undercloud install' to reflect the tooling
update.

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/tripleo/2016/tripleo.2016-11-29-14.00.log.html

Change-Id: I12c4cdd6c61188a570b8d891d30af36bac794157

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-28 13:15:53.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_common/actions/baremetal.py', 'tripleo_common/actions/parameters.py'], 'message': "Convert exceptions to strings when passing them to the Result class

The Mistral Result class expects the error property to be either a
string or a dict. Other types, like exceptions, can cause errors in
mistral which in turn cause a critical failure. See the Mistral bug
report: https://bugs.launchpad.net/mistral/+bug/1645295

This change also updates one use of the Result class that doesn't use
kwargs.

Change-Id: Ia93f298e5181bae92d7a08468d33c255d38b996a
Closes-Bug: #1645296
"}]
commit_message:
Convert exceptions to strings when passing them to the Result class

The Mistral Result class expects the error property to be either a
string or a dict. Other types, like exceptions, can cause errors in
mistral which in turn cause a critical failure. See the Mistral bug
report: https://bugs.launchpad.net/mistral/+bug/1645295

This change also updates one use of the Result class that doesn't use
kwargs.

Change-Id: Ia93f298e5181bae92d7a08468d33c255d38b996a
Closes-Bug: #1645296

commit_message:
Add system-uuid based hostname entries

This patch adds entries to /etc/hosts based on the unique and
hardware-based system uuid. This makes it possible to use predefined
fixed hostnames even before a host has been started, for example to use
within Swift rings that are computed in advance.

Related-Bug: 1609421
Change-Id: I70738c42fad24aa27b0ee81250e5d8c2c9afb0f7

commit_message:
conf: remove deprecated nova quota options

CRUD operations on tenant networks are only available when using nova-network
and nova-network is itself deprecated. Listed below are the related to
quota API configuration options that have been removed:

- enable_network_quota
- quota_networks

Change-Id: Ib660e1e40f5b1d37fd09516626fab38ccd7de94a
Implements: bp centralize-config-options-ocata

Changing FQDN for nodes in already deployed clusters may lead
to unexpected behavior. That's why in case of redeployment
'get_node_fqdn' method firstly should try to fetch FQDN from
cluster settings in /etc/fuel/cluster/{cluster_id}/astute.yaml

Closes-Bug: #1641140
"}]
commit_message:
Don't change FQDN for nodes in already deployed clusters

Changing FQDN for nodes in already deployed clusters may lead
to unexpected behavior. That's why in case of redeployment
'get_node_fqdn' method firstly should try to fetch FQDN from
cluster settings in /etc/fuel/cluster/{cluster_id}/astute.yaml

Change-Id: I2d0ffab32823c578c55bb83dcdea97ddb6fca38e
Closes-Bug: #1641140

conf: add min flags to scheduler opts

* attestation_auth_timeout

subject: Prepare for using standard py27 test
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-09 08:26:32.000000000', 'files': ['tools/test-setup.sh'], 'message': 'Prepare for using standard py27 test

Instead of setting up spark in the CI job, move the set up here so that
it can be reused by other jobs as well.

Create a test-setup.sh script that developer can also use to setup their
own environment.

This makes it easier for monasca-analytics to change the setup,
documents the setup, and enables developer to reuse it.

For details see:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-November/107784.html

Change-Id: Id1a0b8d44d5a258746dd1f443610293163e64096
Needed-By: I0fdce1a977f59cdcb8c63c2b215316cbfcf4fef4
'}]
commit_message:
Prepare for using standard py27 test

Instead of setting up spark in the CI job, move the set up here so that
it can be reused by other jobs as well.

Create a test-setup.sh script that developer can also use to setup their
own environment.

This makes it easier for monasca-analytics to change the setup,
documents the setup, and enables developer to reuse it.

For details see:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-November/107784.html

Change-Id: Id1a0b8d44d5a258746dd1f443610293163e64096
Needed-By: I0fdce1a977f59cdcb8c63c2b215316cbfcf4fef4

subject: Increase subuid/subgid range for root user
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-12 16:56:46.000000000', 'files': ['unit_tests/test_lxd_utils.py', 'hooks/lxd_utils.py', 'tests/basic_deployment.py', 'tests/lxd_amulet_utils.py'], 'message': "Increase subuid/subgid range for root user

To support use of distinct subuid/subgid ranges per LXD container,
the default range for the root user must be increased to support
> 1 running container in this configuration.

Increase subuid/subgid range to support 5000 containers with distinct
ranges.  Restart LXD daemon if idmap configuration changes, to ensure
that the full range of subid's are used.

(also fix amulet tests for OpenStack Newton).

Change-Id: I8b87dad736abaffdbd7afac090429790d3b03c96
Closes-Bug: 1648056
(cherry picked from commit f0773c995220f400ca6b4d5eca04ad9ee919202a)
"}]
commit_message:
Increase subuid/subgid range for root user

To support use of distinct subuid/subgid ranges per LXD container,
the default range for the root user must be increased to support
> 1 running container in this configuration.

Increase subuid/subgid range to support 5000 containers with distinct
ranges.  Restart LXD daemon if idmap configuration changes, to ensure
that the full range of subid's are used.

(also fix amulet tests for OpenStack Newton).

commit_message:
Make identity v3 domains_client use **kwargs

As we discussed on
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-July/068864.html
All http POST/PUT methods need to contain **kwargs as their arguments.

This patch makes identity v3 domains_client use **kwargs.

Also add and correct doc string link.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: Ibe27a399e5b2774aae2c3585e2299616583c25f9

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14819, 'name': 'Timofey Durakov', 'email': 'timofei.nd@gmail.com', 'username': 'tdurakov'}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 19590, 'name': 'Sarafraj Singh', 'email': 'Sarafraj.Singh@intel.com', 'username': 'sarafrajsingh'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-06 16:45:49.000000000', 'files': ['nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': 'Pass context as kwarg instead of positional arg to get_engine

There are a couple of places in nova/db/api/sqlalchemy.py where the
context argument is passed as a positional arg instead of a kwarg,
causing it to be erroneously mapped to the use_slave kwarg:

  def get_engine(use_slave=False, context=None):

This corrects to calls to pass context=context instead.

Change-Id: I8fb7f04a54d9f7f645df8287cdda0ae665a22368
'}]
commit_message:
Pass context as kwarg instead of positional arg to get_engine

There are a couple of places in nova/db/api/sqlalchemy.py where the
context argument is passed as a positional arg instead of a kwarg,
causing it to be erroneously mapped to the use_slave kwarg:

  def get_engine(use_slave=False, context=None):

This corrects to calls to pass context=context instead.

Change-Id: I8fb7f04a54d9f7f645df8287cdda0ae665a22368

commit_message:
Include alembic migrations in module

Explicitly include all alembic data in installed python module,
ensuring that installations directly from git repositories are
fully functional when compared to use of sdist generated tarballs
from tarballs.openstack.org or pypi.

Closes-Bug: 1627656

Change-Id: I445481445b6b5c0649a95f775042ba4067e83aa3

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-10-13 15:52:26.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Add debug to tox environment

The oslotest package distributes a shell file that may be used to assist
in debugging python code. The shell file uses testtools, and supports
debugging with pdb. Debug tox environment implements following test
instructions.
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Testr#Debugging_.28pdb.29_Tests

To enable debugging, run tox with the debug environment. Below are the
following ways to run it.

 * tox -e debug module
 * tox -e debug module.test_class
 * tox -e debug module.test_class.test_method

Change-Id: I08937845803be7bd125b838ab07bda56f202e88d
Closes-Bug: 1632486
'}]
commit_message:
Add debug to tox environment

The oslotest package distributes a shell file that may be used to assist
in debugging python code. The shell file uses testtools, and supports
debugging with pdb. Debug tox environment implements following test
instructions.
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Testr#Debugging_.28pdb.29_Tests

To enable debugging, run tox with the debug environment. Below are the
following ways to run it.

 * tox -e debug module
 * tox -e debug module.test_class
 * tox -e debug module.test_class.test_method

Change-Id: I08937845803be7bd125b838ab07bda56f202e88d
Closes-Bug: 1632486

commit_message:
Remove mysqld_safe from mysql-wss OCF

Pacemaker controls mysqld, thus we don't need mysqld_safe wrapper which
does the same. This should help to get statuses for OCF scripts on very
high loaded systems

Change-Id: I73649d60c3cc08cbe696c6bc97ee5aa0ad430908
Related-Bug: 1636841
Signed-off-by: Sergii Golovatiuk <sgolovatiuk@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I2ac66348723d67d1edc1d2ac803b24cddaa9d51f

commit_message:
Utility function for API request conversion

This patch proposes a utility function for converting raw API requests
into versioned API request objects. The function does request class
lookup, primitive validation, json schema validation and object version
conversion in a batch. The goal is to use it in API layer to further
remove the duplicated request conversion logics.

Change-Id: I2ac66348723d67d1edc1d2ac803b24cddaa9d51f

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2271, 'name': 'Michael Still', 'email': 'mikal@stillhq.com', 'username': 'mikalstill'}, {'_account_id': 4690, 'name': 'melanie witt', 'display_name': 'melwitt', 'email': 'melwittt@gmail.com', 'username': 'melwitt'}, {'_account_id': 7634, 'name': 'Takashi Natsume', 'email': 'takanattie@gmail.com', 'username': 'natsumet'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9555, 'name': 'Matthew Booth', 'email': 'mbooth@redhat.com', 'username': 'MatthewBooth'}, {'_account_id': 14384, 'name': 'Quobyte OpenStack CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci-external@quobyte.com', 'username': 'quobyteci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15751, 'name': 'Intel PCI CI', 'email': 'pci-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intelpcici', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15888, 'name': 'Zhenyu Zheng', 'email': 'zheng.zhenyu@outlook.com', 'username': 'Kevin_Zheng'}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 18602, 'name': 'Gábor Antal', 'email': 'antal@inf.u-szeged.hu', 'username': 'antal'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-23 21:21:52.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/functional/notification_sample_tests/test_instance.py'], 'message': 'Fix race in test_volume_swap_server_with_error

This functional test is waiting for a flag to be set in
the CinderFixture which is called when swap_volume calls
volume_api.unreserve_volume after the swap_volume error
occurs. That happens after the two swap-volume notifications
are sent (for start and error).

The test was asserting a 5th notification for the generic
instance fault, which happens, but might not happen before
the CinderFixture flag is set and the test checks for 5
notifications.

This test really only cares that there are the two swap-volume
notifications, so to avoid a race this change just makes
the test assert that there are at least 4 versioned notifications
by the time the swap-volume error occurs, which is all it was
checking after that anyway.

Change-Id: I8fd44b083f109c034958a305a4e41f9d810c4389
Closes-Bug: #1639894
'}]
commit_message:
Fix race in test_volume_swap_server_with_error

This functional test is waiting for a flag to be set in
the CinderFixture which is called when swap_volume calls
volume_api.unreserve_volume after the swap_volume error
occurs. That happens after the two swap-volume notifications
are sent (for start and error).

The test was asserting a 5th notification for the generic
instance fault, which happens, but might not happen before
the CinderFixture flag is set and the test checks for 5
notifications.

This test really only cares that there are the two swap-volume
notifications, so to avoid a race this change just makes
the test assert that there are at least 4 versioned notifications
by the time the swap-volume error occurs, which is all it was
checking after that anyway.

Change-Id: I8fd44b083f109c034958a305a4e41f9d810c4389
Closes-Bug: #1639894

commit_message:
Show team and repo badges on README

This patch adds the team's and repository's badges to the README file.
The motivation behind this is to communicate the project status and
features at first glance.

For more information about this effort, please read this email thread:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-October/105562.html

To see an example of how this would look like check:

https://gist.github.com/eb5fd048a8c0897aac80c1675094b4ed

commit_message:
Refactor DHCP app for code reusage

Reuse code in the dhcp reply packets generation

There are also other minor changes in the app to make it simpler:
* use ofport to identify port rather than metadata
* Take constants from ryu where possible

commit_message:
Add object version pinning

To support rolling upgrades, capping of Ironic objects is required.
Old objects may still be in use while an upgrade is in progress. This
makes sure that all objects will be used in capped version.
This patch depends on related work in RPC communication.

Change-Id: I6755b561cc6425304ed6f26d5e8c47a929cf331f
Partial-Bug: #1526283

commit_message:
Remove django-openstack-auth-kerberos

This repo is no longer managed or needed. The use of kerberos with
keystone and horizon is now supported via federation. This repo
has been largely inactive since horizon added it.

Change-Id: I4e09fc2fa0888334e1ec90b1829eb0c065f79bb3

revisions:

We have a voting grenade job since Newton to validate upgrade path.
The upgrade procedure itself is documented at:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/ironic-inspector/upgrade.html

Standard deprecation path is followed. Release notes are published at:
http://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/ironic-inspector/

Also fixes missing link to the documentation.

Change-Id: Idae9be0606ad9634ed4dd5c9f697ec02aaf06a62
'}]
commit_message:
Claim supports-upgrade and follows-standard-deprecation for ironic-inspector

We have a voting grenade job since Newton to validate upgrade path.
The upgrade procedure itself is documented at:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/ironic-inspector/upgrade.html

Standard deprecation path is followed. Release notes are published at:
http://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/ironic-inspector/

Also fixes missing link to the documentation.

Change-Id: Idae9be0606ad9634ed4dd5c9f697ec02aaf06a62

subject: Fix ironic-compute task ordering
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-12 09:24:25.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/openstack_tasks/examples/ironic/tasks.yaml'], 'message': 'Fix ironic-compute task ordering

Both openstack-network/server-nova task and ironic/ironic-compute task
declare ::nova::network::neutron class with same parameters,
in case when ironic-compute task is applied before server-nova task,
nova-api service will not be refreshed, because nova_config resources
from ::nova::network::neutron were not updated.

This patch ensures that ironic-compute task will be applied
after openstack network configuration.

Change-Id: Ie13df7d2ceaa204bdd1958b79949487c2dbd24fe
Closes-Bug: #1646833
'}]
commit_message:
Fix ironic-compute task ordering

Both openstack-network/server-nova task and ironic/ironic-compute task
declare ::nova::network::neutron class with same parameters,
in case when ironic-compute task is applied before server-nova task,
nova-api service will not be refreshed, because nova_config resources
from ::nova::network::neutron were not updated.

This patch ensures that ironic-compute task will be applied
after openstack network configuration.

Change-Id: Ie13df7d2ceaa204bdd1958b79949487c2dbd24fe
Closes-Bug: #1646833

uniform the method name for resource operations

all the methods look like this:

action + "_" + resource

action:create/update/delete/get

resource:
lswitch/lport/lrouter/security_group/floatingip...

commit_message:
Add parameter in CLUSTER_DEL_NODES action

Add a parameter to CLUSTER_DEL_NODES action.
If the value is True, deleted nodes to be destroyed
right away, instead of becoming orphan nodes

subject: Add Constraints support
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-04 17:28:04.000000000', 'files': ['tools/tox_install.sh', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Add Constraints support

Adding constraints support to clients is slightly more complex than
services as the clients themselves are listed in upper-constraints.txt
which leads to errors that you can't install a specific version and a
constrained version.

This change adds constraints support by also adding a helper script to
edit the constraints to remove monasca-log-api.

Change-Id: Iac96425ce785890b1bd06fe00f5b666a6ecdbc61
"}]
commit_message:
Add Constraints support

Adding constraints support to clients is slightly more complex than
services as the clients themselves are listed in upper-constraints.txt
which leads to errors that you can't install a specific version and a
constrained version.

This change adds constraints support by also adding a helper script to
edit the constraints to remove monasca-log-api.

Change-Id: Iac96425ce785890b1bd06fe00f5b666a6ecdbc61

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-12-01 09:40:19.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/manager.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/group/test_groups_manager.py'], 'message': 'Correct the attributes of volume which created by clone a CG

If a volume in a consistency group is bootable or allow
multi-attach, after clone the consistency group, the created
volume is not bootable and allow multi-attach is set to False.
This patch will correct the attributes of volume according to
the source volume.

Change-Id: Icb4fad78cb218a134bb87e7d522829297cf93b94
Closes-Bug: #1498783
'}]
commit_message:
Correct the attributes of volume which created by clone a CG

If a volume in a consistency group is bootable or allow
multi-attach, after clone the consistency group, the created
volume is not bootable and allow multi-attach is set to False.
This patch will correct the attributes of volume according to
the source volume.

Change-Id: Icb4fad78cb218a134bb87e7d522829297cf93b94
Closes-Bug: #1498783

commit_message:
Enable py35 voting on Nova

The py35 job runs without error on the project Nova,
therefore we can safely enabling voting. Reference patch:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/403548/

This patch also drops py34 voting job.

Change-Id: I8a1293e78e6e7ac3d454e3043840173c2ba049ec

commit_message:
Make the linters job on governance voting

This job was introduced a while ago as non-voting and was green.
Relevantly recently a change landed that broke it.  Lets make it voting
to prevent that from happening.

Also given that it's voting add it to the gate pipeline also.

Change-Id: I0612e2b1ebc87932b85b0b4dfc4f3fe46da22609

Support shared path for glance images and nova instances disk

Mount glance-api docker /var/lib/glance to specified path on host.

potentially slow answering services

commit_message:
Fixing headers across all files

Adding Openstack copyright where it was missing.
In places where both IBM and Openstack appear
IBM appears first

Bonus: Deleting all ansible management files
which are planned to be removed anyway with
the transition to a devstack installation

Change-Id: I49449227cd17ebf6caa848a091c241b1b6430fa5

commit_message:
Generate separate db for murano service broker

Implement some changes for murano-cfapi service, mainly
including:
1.Add separate murano-cfapi.conf for murano-cfapi service
2.Add separate command murano-cfapi-db-manage for murano_cfapi db

Change-Id: I2a675a30e84ce03cc3cd5fb6fb5a6318498ac913
Closes-Bug: #1589445

subject: Handle ambiguous physical resource IDs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-05 19:58:52.000000000', 'files': ['heat/api/middleware/fault.py', 'heat/api/aws/exception.py', 'heat/db/api.py', 'heat/common/exception.py', 'heat/tests/engine/service/test_software_config.py', 'heat/tests/db/test_sqlalchemy_api.py', 'heat/objects/resource.py', 'heat/db/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'heat/engine/service.py'], 'message': "Handle ambiguous physical resource IDs

It's possible that we could end up with multiple resources with the same
physical resource ID, but that would be undetectable since we return only
one from the database layer. This change allows us to detect the problem an
return an error where the result is rendered ambiguous.

Change-Id: I2c5ddbe6731c33a09ec7c4a7b91dcfe414da4385
"}]
commit_message:
Handle ambiguous physical resource IDs

It's possible that we could end up with multiple resources with the same
physical resource ID, but that would be undetectable since we return only
one from the database layer. This change allows us to detect the problem an
return an error where the result is rendered ambiguous.

Change-Id: I2c5ddbe6731c33a09ec7c4a7b91dcfe414da4385

subject: Tell shade which services are running
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-12 17:12:34.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/shade.yaml'], 'message': "Tell shade which services are running

Shade has traps in its tests to only run tests on services that exist.
However, that can allow skipping of tests that _should_ run in a given
config. Add explicit variables for the things we expect to exist in the
gate so that if they're missing all of a sudden we'll see test jobs
fail.

Change-Id: I2433c7bced6c8ca785634056de45ddf624031509
"}]
commit_message:
Tell shade which services are running

Shade has traps in its tests to only run tests on services that exist.
However, that can allow skipping of tests that _should_ run in a given
config. Add explicit variables for the things we expect to exist in the
gate so that if they're missing all of a sudden we'll see test jobs
fail.

Change-Id: I2433c7bced6c8ca785634056de45ddf624031509

subject: Split magnum shade support into its own job
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-12 16:44:12.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/shade.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Split magnum shade support into its own job

The magnum team reports problems with having magnum and all the other
services enabled at the same time due to memory pressure. We see a
flakier gate when we have magnum enabled than when we don't. So - split
out magnum support into its own job that does not include swift, heat or
designate, then include swift, heat and designate in the other jobs.
Finally, turn off horizon and ceilometer from the gate since we do not
test either of them.

Change-Id: I7e7ede279be2acabd469fbe997ae54743768dfd8
"}]
commit_message:
Split magnum shade support into its own job

The magnum team reports problems with having magnum and all the other
services enabled at the same time due to memory pressure. We see a
flakier gate when we have magnum enabled than when we don't. So - split
out magnum support into its own job that does not include swift, heat or
designate, then include swift, heat and designate in the other jobs.
Finally, turn off horizon and ceilometer from the gate since we do not
test either of them.

Change-Id: I7e7ede279be2acabd469fbe997ae54743768dfd8

commit_message:
add support for vhost-user reconnect

- This change introduces support for createing
  dpdkvhostuserclient type port in ovs.
- This change allows vhost-user to be configured with
  qemu as the vhost server and ovs as the client allowing
  the vhost frontend to reconnect to the backend in
  the event the backend restarts.

Change-Id: Ie22e12c9578a2f5bd89a37b9e80efef7ae055b7a

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 782, 'name': 'John Garbutt', 'email': 'john.garbutt@stackhpc.com', 'username': 'johngarbutt'}, {'_account_id': 1063, 'name': 'Ed Leafe', 'email': 'ed@leafe.com', 'username': 'ed-leafe'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 6849, 'name': 'Roman Podoliaka', 'email': 'roman.podoliaka@gmail.com', 'username': 'rpodolyaka'}, {'_account_id': 16128, 'name': 'IBM PowerVM CI', 'email': 'powervmci@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powervmci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-12 14:07:01.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/functional/db/test_resource_provider.py'], 'message': "Quiet unicode warnings in functional test_resource_provider

The 'name' filter values passed to the ResourceProviderList object
are expected to be unicode. When not unicode the tests produce
warnings which are noise since that's not what is actually being
tested. This change makes the values unicode and thus shuts up the
warnings.

Change-Id: Iebc50ff2ced120d5004fa6d053401469097beb1b
"}]
commit_message:
Quiet unicode warnings in functional test_resource_provider

The 'name' filter values passed to the ResourceProviderList object
are expected to be unicode. When not unicode the tests produce
warnings which are noise since that's not what is actually being
tested. This change makes the values unicode and thus shuts up the
warnings.

Change-Id: Iebc50ff2ced120d5004fa6d053401469097beb1b

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2874, 'name': 'yong sheng gong', 'email': 'gong.yongsheng@99cloud.net', 'username': 'gongysh'}, {'_account_id': 13380, 'name': 'Sridhar Ramaswamy', 'email': 'srics.r@gmail.com', 'username': 'srics-r'}, {'_account_id': 16237, 'name': 'venkatamahesh', 'email': 'venkatamaheshkotha@gmail.com', 'username': 'venkatamahesh'}, {'_account_id': 20251, 'name': 'LiuYong', 'email': 'liu.yong8@zte.com.cn', 'username': 'LiuYong'}, {'_account_id': 20256, 'name': 'Zhigang Li', 'email': 'li.zhigang3@zte.com.cn', 'username': 'lizhigang'}, {'_account_id': 20566, 'name': 'BaiLinZhang', 'email': 'bailin.zhang@hotmail.com', 'username': 'bailin.zhang'}, {'_account_id': 20986, 'name': 'Manikantha Srinivas Tadi', 'email': 'manikantha.tadi@gmail.com', 'username': 'mtadi'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-23 06:33:01.000000000', 'files': ['tacker/policy.py', 'tacker/api/extensions.py', 'tacker/tests/unit/test_api_v2.py', 'tacker/wsgi.py'], 'message': 'Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems to achieve iterators.
We can use dict.items instead, as it will return iterators in PY3 as well.
And dict.items/keys will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance about
list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I9824ddb528784857cac512254db01706e625f1d6
'}]
commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems to achieve iterators.
We can use dict.items instead, as it will return iterators in PY3 as well.
And dict.items/keys will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance about
list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I9824ddb528784857cac512254db01706e625f1d6

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-09 06:05:18.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/static/dashboard/project/workflow/launch-instance/launch-instance-model.service.js', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/static/dashboard/project/workflow/launch-instance/details/details.html', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/static/dashboard/project/workflow/launch-instance/launch-instance-model.service.spec.js'], 'message': "Let Nova to pick availability zone if more than 1

In the Angular Launch Instance, if there is more than one availability zone,
default to the option for the Nova scheduler to pick.  This is a regression
from the legacy Launch Instance feature.

If you want to simulate testing the logic with multiple avaiability zones,
go to:  .../launch-instance/launch-instance-model.service.js line 785 and add:

model.availabilityZones.push({label: 'another one', value: 'another one'});

Change-Id: Ib81447382bc9d43e33ce97f78c085d2a94ff2018
Closes-Bug: 1613900
(cherry picked from commit be6bcef45289ce1a934db478e5c9c7705890af18)
"}]
commit_message:
Let Nova to pick availability zone if more than 1

In the Angular Launch Instance, if there is more than one availability zone,
default to the option for the Nova scheduler to pick.  This is a regression
from the legacy Launch Instance feature.

If you want to simulate testing the logic with multiple avaiability zones,
go to:  .../launch-instance/launch-instance-model.service.js line 785 and add:

model.availabilityZones.push({label: 'another one', value: 'another one'});

Change-Id: Ib81447382bc9d43e33ce97f78c085d2a94ff2018
Closes-Bug: 1613900
(cherry picked from commit be6bcef45289ce1a934db478e5c9c7705890af18)

commit_message:
Fixes traceback if group name attribute is missing

This works around an issue where certain backends (e.g. LDAP)
did not provide a group name, only ID, which would cause most
identity management tasks in Horizon to fail. If no name is
provided, the ID is duplicated as the group name.

Change-Id: Iea87abf38d26cb2baff43521c7dd2ae0a00e9997
Closes-Bug: #1593571
(cherry picked from commit cb664ecf18bc68f03bc0a2ccff66d285872cde59)

Adds the enable_new_services parameter to the
nova::conductor class. When a new nova services
is started the conductor will create the services.
If enable_new_services is set to False it will set

(cherry picked from commit 6bb922b140f6f1dbac39729eae4c4ec0669900be)

commit_message:
Add the enable_new_services option to nova::conductor

Adds the enable_new_services parameter to the
nova::conductor class. When a new nova services
is started the conductor will create the services.
If enable_new_services is set to False it will set
them to disabled when they are added.

Default value for the enable_new_services option
is True which is the default in the nova code.

Change-Id: I91bfc7a04071025a58629641b5da4f8347cfc133
(cherry picked from commit 6bb922b140f6f1dbac39729eae4c4ec0669900be)

commit_message:
docker-cmd hook handle empty config file

Early in a server boot the file /var/run/heat-config/heat-config may
exist but be empty. This causes a stack trace to be raised in this
script.

This change detects a json parse error and exits gracefully.

Change-Id: I29d731098659bfbf10a2caf80c2cfc49de5df4cc
Closes-Bug: #1648249

commit_message:
filtered out the phynical nics when query vm nics with VMware API

When querying the info for vm nics with param set to vm moid, VSphere API will
return all nics in this vm and all nics in the host. Maybe we need to filter
out the phynical nics.

Closes-Bug: #1646663

subject: Set auth in clients before they are used
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-12-12 14:14:47.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/scenario/test_security_groups_basic_ops.py', 'tempest/test.py'], 'message': 'Set auth in clients before they are used

When credentials are preprovisioned, and thus read from a file,
only the fields configured in accounts.yaml are available in the
credentials object. Several tests rely on used_id / project_id
being available in the credentials object. To ensure a consistent
behaviour between dynamic and preprovisioned credentials, setting
auth in the client manager before it is returned to the test, so
that all fields are available.

test_security_groups_basic_ops has its own solution for filling in
IDs, which is broken, so removing it and let it rely on the IDs
being there.

Change-Id: I3450c055c63782a97413606f90ad77b7dba452f1
Partial-bug: #1609156
'}]
commit_message:
Set auth in clients before they are used

When credentials are preprovisioned, and thus read from a file,
only the fields configured in accounts.yaml are available in the
credentials object. Several tests rely on used_id / project_id
being available in the credentials object. To ensure a consistent
behaviour between dynamic and preprovisioned credentials, setting
auth in the client manager before it is returned to the test, so
that all fields are available.

test_security_groups_basic_ops has its own solution for filling in
IDs, which is broken, so removing it and let it rely on the IDs
being there.

Change-Id: I3450c055c63782a97413606f90ad77b7dba452f1
Partial-bug: #1609156

subject: Use assertIsNone(...) instead of assertIs(None, ...).
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-08 08:10:09.000000000', 'files': ['murano/tests/unit/dsl/test_context_manager.py'], 'message': 'Use assertIsNone(...) instead of assertIs(None, ...).

Refer to:http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises

[H203] Use assertIs(Not)None to check for None (off by default) Unit 
test assertions tend to give better messages for more specific assertions. 
As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred over assertEqual(None, ...)
and assertIs(None, ...)

Change-Id: I7a73aa1766aefe3920fe0c80717cc7f6733c2d36
'}]
commit_message:
Use assertIsNone(...) instead of assertIs(None, ...).

Refer to:http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises

[H203] Use assertIs(Not)None to check for None (off by default) Unit 
test assertions tend to give better messages for more specific assertions. 
As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred over assertEqual(None, ...)
and assertIs(None, ...)

Change-Id: I7a73aa1766aefe3920fe0c80717cc7f6733c2d36

commit_message:
Remove agent-membership extension

It has never been ready to use.

- It's implemented for cluster API only.
- It has no client support.

Besides that, there seems no demands for the functionality in
the foreseeable future.  Let's remove it for now, rather than
pretending to maintain the unused code.

Closes-Bug: #1580441
Change-Id: Ib6332736ac96f938bf08493404ede768153b407b

commit_message:
Correct reraising of exception

When an exception was caught and rethrown, it should
call 'raise' without any arguments because it shows
the place where an exception occured initially instead
of place where the exception re-raised

Change-Id: I3e625cbd44b87de0997cd76a471682c732a4d1e5

commit_message:
Correct murano reraising of exception

When an exception was caught and rethrown, it should call 'raise'
without any arguments because it shows the place where an
exception occured initially instead of place where
the exception re-raised

Change-Id: I9cf6a8e2b6350eec2e010894b6a27f792e3f4368

commit_message:
Add "replication-promote" and "replication-reenable" options to "volume set"

Implement the cinder commands:
"cinder replication-promote"
"cinder replication-reenable"
as options "--replication-promote" and "--replication-reenable"
of "volume set" command in OSC (volume v2 only)

Change-Id: I745e997b26dabfda75fb4c52a5ee97d351224144
Closes-Bug: #1645559
Implements: bp cinder-command-support

The middleware now allows the usage of signatures with a prefix-based
scope. A prefix-based signature grants access to all objects which share
the same prefix. This avoids the creation of a large amount of signatures,
when a whole container or pseudofolder is shared.

Please see spec: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/199607/

Change-Id: I03b68eb74dae6196b5e63e711ef642ff7d2cfdc9
'}]
commit_message:
tempurls with a prefix-based scope

The middleware now allows the usage of signatures with a prefix-based
scope. A prefix-based signature grants access to all objects which share
the same prefix. This avoids the creation of a large amount of signatures,
when a whole container or pseudofolder is shared.

Please see spec: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/199607/

Change-Id: I03b68eb74dae6196b5e63e711ef642ff7d2cfdc9

commit_message:
[Grenade] Update devstack and pre_test_hook

This commit is partial cherry-pick of [1].

After switch [2] to dummy driver we need to override defaults.
So, update pre_test_hook approach for saving configuration data properly.
Also, do not call neutron APIs if it is not installed.

[1] Ie5fa0f78b0e3caa06d34a0822a8ed60b69406f9d
[2] I2b698f69a29ef983b13534b2f4d393570be4dac8

Depends-On: I6b727ab6a0761a324b13c27bd581a00c0a01ced2
Change-Id: Ie5fa0f78b0e3caa06d34a0822a8ed60b69406f9d
Closes-Bug: #1631412

commit_message:
Nightly tests results parser

First 0.5 version of nightly tests results parser to test rail.
Need to be updated after new job for results parser will be created.
Current job with nightly tests:
https://ci.fuel-infra.org/view/All/job/nightly-fuel-web-on-fuel-ui/
Xml results are dropped to directory:
"WORKSPACE/nightly_report_<time in milliseconds>.xml"

Change-Id: Ide10b736bf78af04b2407904f43ca46600010907

commit_message:
backward compatibility for text_list

In 9.0 release text_list attribute value has been changed
and now it's list of strings. The old releases have also
this type of attribute and it's value is generated by
generator from_settings what is incorrect in terms of
9.0 release, because old text_list type should be
comma separated list. Hence migration has been added
to avoid such problems with old releases.

Change-Id: I221916fee0349728e231fa586ec638a2547625cd
Closes-Bug: #1597736

commit_message:
Make UUIDField actually validate UUIDs

Instead of using oslo.versionedobjects UUID type, use a custom UUIDField
class located in common_types that will actually validate passed values
for UUID-ness.

Closes-Bug: #1614537
Change-Id: I20b24ee57c521b1c68977c2ff7ae56b56875dd64

revisions:
[{'number': 13, 'created': '2016-12-12 20:36:50.000000000', 'files': ['ci-scripts/usbkey/usb_requirements.txt', 'requirements.txt', 'roles/libvirt/setup/undercloud/files/get-undercloud-ip.sh', 'roles/libvirt/setup/undercloud/tasks/main.yml', 'roles/libvirt/setup/undercloud/tasks/inject_repos.yml', 'roles/libvirt/setup/undercloud/tasks/update_image.yml'], 'message': "Update OOOQ to ansible 2.2

- Ansible 2.2 removed some deprecations:
  * with_ 'bare variable' handling, now loop items must always be
    templated {{ }} or they will be considered as plain strings.
  * skipping task on 'missing attribute' in loop variable, now in a loop an
    undefined attribute will return an error instead of skipping the task.
  * skipping on undefined variables in loop, now loops will have to define a
    variable or use |default to avoid errors.

Change-Id: Ic751ae1111f3083aa3188afe625bbd07bb4c02a0
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Update OOOQ to ansible 2.2

- Ansible 2.2 removed some deprecations:
  * with_ 'bare variable' handling, now loop items must always be
    templated {{ }} or they will be considered as plain strings.
  * skipping task on 'missing attribute' in loop variable, now in a loop an
    undefined attribute will return an error instead of skipping the task.
  * skipping on undefined variables in loop, now loops will have to define a
    variable or use |default to avoid errors.

Change-Id: Ic751ae1111f3083aa3188afe625bbd07bb4c02a0
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

subject: Replace six.iteritems() with .items()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-07 03:01:20.000000000', 'files': ['rally/task/service.py'], 'message': 'Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can use
dict.items instead, as it will return iterators
in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more
readable. 2.In py2, the performance about list
should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I1eb354d532da68f67af544bc264bf2e7e44b3f49
'}]
commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can use
dict.items instead, as it will return iterators
in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more
readable. 2.In py2, the performance about list
should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I1eb354d532da68f67af544bc264bf2e7e44b3f49

subject: Reduce min-ready for ubuntu-trusty to 1
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-10 17:47:19.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/nodepool.yaml'], 'message': "Reduce min-ready for ubuntu-trusty to 1

Now that our migration to ubuntu-xenial for jobs is finished, we can
now reduce ubuntu-trusty to 1.  I know this is a little agressive, but
since our time to ready for nodes is 30seconds on most clouds, its
something I wouldn't mind test driving to see how nodepool reacts to
the demand.

Change-Id: I3d0cdbba06a265729670ada6c541b46838f448a5
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Reduce min-ready for ubuntu-trusty to 1

Now that our migration to ubuntu-xenial for jobs is finished, we can
now reduce ubuntu-trusty to 1.  I know this is a little agressive, but
since our time to ready for nodes is 30seconds on most clouds, its
something I wouldn't mind test driving to see how nodepool reacts to
the demand.

Change-Id: I3d0cdbba06a265729670ada6c541b46838f448a5
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-12 21:23:59.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'openstack-dev repos: Trusty cleanup

The changed repos have no stable branches, so we can remove all trusty
jbos that are run on them including python34-jobs.

While this change removes job, the jobs run on any change stays the
same.

Change-Id: I71dbf88a9c7b9bbf9c6e6723f0253d31a2c069e3
'}]
commit_message:
openstack-dev repos: Trusty cleanup

The changed repos have no stable branches, so we can remove all trusty
jbos that are run on them including python34-jobs.

While this change removes job, the jobs run on any change stays the
same.

Change-Id: I71dbf88a9c7b9bbf9c6e6723f0253d31a2c069e3

commit_message:
Refactor ironic-ui documentation to remove warnings

Warnings, such as those caused by the README.rst file's
inclusion of an externally hosted file cause the default
sphinx job to fail. Removed the link, and cleaned up the
documentation formatting to make it more clear moving
forward.

Change-Id: I55afe786b794a6cb179a3de20b5f4e0f3f8072c8

commit_message:
Use constranits for api-ref target

It should be ok to use zuul-cloner these days. [1]
This would avoid docutils 0.13.1, which seems to cause the following
TypeError.

    Exception occurred:
      File "/home/jenkins/workspace/gate-neutron-lib-api-ref/.tox/api-ref/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/docutils/writers/html4css1/__init__.py", line 288, in write_colspecs
        width += node['colwidth']
    TypeError: unsupported operand type(s) for +=: 'int' and 'str'

[1] I8f45a53429b9fcbf3689a268f096afdf5f32f461

Closes-Bug: #1649079
Change-Id: Id75e88f5031aeab21b2158c721881bf2da4a0d28

commit_message:
Pin older openstack-selinux

The newer version of openstack-selinux-0.7.12-1.el7 has broken running
keystone under apache. Pin to an older version until BZ#1402926 can be
resolved.

Change-Id: I0c17dec53bc7e3b97dd3232c579221b8a1418e51
(cherry picked from commit 40edc5d5a53da8b632be421f485c3f0bd6eeb654)

commit_message:
Add the remote tag to the badge image

Latest docutils complains about images that are not in the same repo
unless they are properly marked as `:remote:`.

See: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-December
/108710.html
