commit_message:
Correct syntax error in reference/legacy.yaml

Currently ther linters target is failing with[1]:

 syntax error: mapping values are not allowed here

Fix that.

Once this is done we can make linters a voting job to prevent errors
like this slipping in.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/85/314485/5/check/gate-governance-linters-ubuntu-xenial/9337cc8/console.html#_2016-12-12_13_12_29_254115

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-01 15:04:33.000000000', 'files': ['networking_bagpipe/agent/bagpipe_bgp_agent.py', 'networking_bagpipe/tests/unit/agent/test_bagpipe_bgp_agent.py'], 'message': "Use patch-port:vlan i.o. linux interface as linuxif

Providing the linuxinterface (qvoxxxx) as 'linuxif' to bagpipe-bgp
is not as harmless as it should be, because this is the key used
to determine when the last plug on an interface is done.

This patch provides the patch-port:vlan tuple instead, which should
allow bagpipe-bgp current code to properly identify the unplug of the
last VM on a Network on a given compute node.

Change-Id: I1f38815e188b4d0cd72b15d66319194fcfce1e0a
Closes-Bug: 1644151
(cherry picked from commit e715f1531d1bd2c776a8d1cf02a80ffb80ebb25e)
"}]
commit_message:
Use patch-port:vlan i.o. linux interface as linuxif

Providing the linuxinterface (qvoxxxx) as 'linuxif' to bagpipe-bgp
is not as harmless as it should be, because this is the key used
to determine when the last plug on an interface is done.

This patch provides the patch-port:vlan tuple instead, which should
allow bagpipe-bgp current code to properly identify the unplug of the
last VM on a Network on a given compute node.

Change-Id: I1f38815e188b4d0cd72b15d66319194fcfce1e0a
Closes-Bug: 1644151
(cherry picked from commit e715f1531d1bd2c776a8d1cf02a80ffb80ebb25e)

unless they are properly marked as `:remote:`.

/108710.html

Closes-Bug: #1649401

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-12-08 21:53:37.000000000', 'files': ['doc/user-guide/zaqar-get-started/os-zaqar-apiGettingStarted.xml', 'doc/source/index.rst', 'doc/source/getting_started.rst', 'doc/source/headers_queue_api_working.rst', 'doc/user-guide/zaqar-get-started/pom.xml', 'doc/source/send_request_api.rst', 'doc/source/authentication_tokens.rst'], 'message': 'Convert user getting started guide to rst

Currently, Zaqar is holding the user related guide as xml format,
which is hard to maintain. Until now, we have moved the config
ref to rst and the API ref is happening as well. So it would be
nice if the user getting started guide can be coverted to rst
as well. This patch does it and removes the old docbook files.

Change-Id: Ib74fb49ba2a5b2c1dea9c6bd75406d804504d392
'}]
commit_message:
Convert user getting started guide to rst

Currently, Zaqar is holding the user related guide as xml format,
which is hard to maintain. Until now, we have moved the config
ref to rst and the API ref is happening as well. So it would be
nice if the user getting started guide can be coverted to rst
as well. This patch does it and removes the old docbook files.

subject: openstack-infra: Job cleanup
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-12 21:26:34.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'openstack-infra: Job cleanup

For projects that only have master branch, remove python34 and trusty
jobs since those will never be run.

Additional changes:

germqtt: Use python35 instead of python34.
openstackid: Add voting docs job to gate as well.
reviewstats: Use python35-nv instead of python34 job.
storyboard: Make python35 jobs voting, they pass like in
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/408297/

infra-publish-jobs template: We do not need the trusty jobs here.

Change-Id: I8249391541b799fbcbbbf609948af0525675a46d
'}]
commit_message:
openstack-infra: Job cleanup

For projects that only have master branch, remove python34 and trusty
jobs since those will never be run.

Additional changes:

germqtt: Use python35 instead of python34.
openstackid: Add voting docs job to gate as well.
reviewstats: Use python35-nv instead of python34 job.
storyboard: Make python35 jobs voting, they pass like in
  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/408297/

infra-publish-jobs template: We do not need the trusty jobs here.

Change-Id: I8249391541b799fbcbbbf609948af0525675a46d

commit_message:
Update code block indentation in readme

Code blocks in the readme are indented with 3 spaces and not 4, which
makes Markdown in GitHub and the Charm store not render them correctly.

This updates the indentation to 4 spaces for all code blocks.

commit_message:
Enable Memcache service for Token Caching

With the release of 4.2.0 of keystonemiddleware using the
in-process token cache is no longer recommended. It is recommended
that a memcache backend to store tokens is used instead,

This installs and configures memcache and configures neutron-server
to use memcache for token caching.

http://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/keystonemiddleware/mitaka.html#id2

Change-Id: I1f7764afb24b511508432fa758596cc9ab40aba8

commit_message:
Fix dsvm failure caused by devstack plugin and event/auditing func.

This patch will fix dsvm failure:
1. The new changes in devstack [1]. Whereby, plugin was not enabled
to use multiple times. Currently, almost functions like fixup_quota,
add_key and add_secgrp enable plugin which runs multiple times.
2. Some functional tests were not working with event/auditing function.
[1]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/396794/

Change-Id: I1846c0df1d59557919a4caa612f2a4c60fbf7ce8
Closes-Bug: #1646807

subject: Add the enable_new_services option to nova::conductor
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-12-12 13:37:19.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/conductor.pp', 'releasenotes/notes/add_enable_new_services_parameter-0174ea25ea8b5de7.yaml', 'spec/classes/nova_conductor_spec.rb'], 'message': 'Add the enable_new_services option to nova::conductor

Adds the enable_new_services parameter to the
nova::conductor class. When a new nova services
is started the conductor will create the services.
If enable_new_services is set to False it will set
them to disabled when they are added.

Default value for the enable_new_services option
is True which is the default in the nova code.

Change-Id: I91bfc7a04071025a58629641b5da4f8347cfc133
'}]
commit_message:
Add the enable_new_services option to nova::conductor

Adds the enable_new_services parameter to the
nova::conductor class. When a new nova services
is started the conductor will create the services.
If enable_new_services is set to False it will set
them to disabled when they are added.

Default value for the enable_new_services option
is True which is the default in the nova code.

Change-Id: I91bfc7a04071025a58629641b5da4f8347cfc133

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6482, 'name': 'Steve Martinelli', 'email': 's.martinelli@gmail.com', 'username': 'stevemar'}, {'_account_id': 8119, 'name': 'Eric Brown', 'email': 'eric_wade_brown@yahoo.com', 'username': 'ericwb'}, {'_account_id': 11022, 'name': 'Rodrigo Duarte Sousa', 'email': 'rodrigodsousa@gmail.com', 'username': 'rodrigods'}, {'_account_id': 17645, 'name': 'Shan Guo', 'email': 'guoshan.jolie@gmail.com', 'username': 'guoshan'}, {'_account_id': 17860, 'name': 'Samuel de Medeiros Queiroz', 'email': 'samueldmq@gmail.com', 'username': 'samueldmq'}, {'_account_id': 18338, 'name': 'Ron De Rose', 'email': 'ronald.de.rose@intel.com', 'username': 'derosenet'}, {'_account_id': 20466, 'name': 'Tin Lam', 'email': 'tin@lam.wtf', 'username': 'tinlam'}, {'_account_id': 21420, 'name': 'Gage Hugo', 'email': 'gagehugo@gmail.com', 'username': 'ghugo'}, {'_account_id': 22604, 'name': 'Samuel Pilla', 'email': 'sp516w@att.com', 'username': 'samuel.pilla'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 16, 'created': '2016-12-10 05:18:22.000000000', 'files': ['api-ref/source/v3/samples/admin/users-in-group-list-password-expired.json', 'api-ref/source/v3/groups.inc', 'api-ref/source/v3/users.inc', 'api-ref/source/v3/parameters.yaml', 'api-ref/source/v3/samples/admin/users-list-password-expired.json'], 'message': 'API Documentation for user password expires

The api documentation for the following queries:

/v3/users?password_expires_at={operator}:{timestamp}
/v3/groups/{group_id}/users?password_expires_at={operator}:{timestamp}

The acceptable operators are lt, lte, gt, gte, eq, and neq.
They allow for querying for a range of timestamps rather than
an exact time for password expiration.

Examples:
- GET /v3/users?password_expires_at=lt:2016-11-06T15:32:17Z
- GET /v3/groups/079c578fd99b428ab61fcd4c9bd88ecd/users?password_expires_at=gt:2016-12-08T22:02:00Z

Partially-Implements: bp pci-dss-query-password-expired-users
Parent-Id: If0b9cc3c8af92b2ea5d41a0e8afeb78e12b7689c
Change-Id: I737dd6b703cc5af16b3d748ebaeebe0fbada039e
'}]
commit_message:
API Documentation for user password expires

The api documentation for the following queries:

/v3/users?password_expires_at={operator}:{timestamp}
/v3/groups/{group_id}/users?password_expires_at={operator}:{timestamp}

The acceptable operators are lt, lte, gt, gte, eq, and neq.
They allow for querying for a range of timestamps rather than
an exact time for password expiration.

Examples:
- GET /v3/users?password_expires_at=lt:2016-11-06T15:32:17Z
- GET /v3/groups/079c578fd99b428ab61fcd4c9bd88ecd/users?password_expires_at=gt:2016-12-08T22:02:00Z

Partially-Implements: bp pci-dss-query-password-expired-users
Parent-Id: If0b9cc3c8af92b2ea5d41a0e8afeb78e12b7689c
Change-Id: I737dd6b703cc5af16b3d748ebaeebe0fbada039e

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-12 09:56:01.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/devstack-gate-bagpipe-rc'], 'message': 'Remove custom OVS compilation trigger for Openstack CI

Compiling a fresh upstream OVS is not required anymore now
that our tempest job is configured to use xenial.

(Note that the devstack-gate-bagpipe-rc script is only used by the
Openstack CI gate scripts so removing the OVS compilation trigger
does not impact non-gate use of the devstack plugin)

Change-Id: I50f2b6275400877e6e727a435406e362390dad46
(cherry-picked from 8b06a30753ecd1fc044eed8e86c01d711c919eef)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove custom OVS compilation trigger for Openstack CI

Compiling a fresh upstream OVS is not required anymore now
that our tempest job is configured to use xenial.

(Note that the devstack-gate-bagpipe-rc script is only used by the
Openstack CI gate scripts so removing the OVS compilation trigger
does not impact non-gate use of the devstack plugin)

Change-Id: I50f2b6275400877e6e727a435406e362390dad46
(cherry-picked from 8b06a30753ecd1fc044eed8e86c01d711c919eef)

subject: Python 3.5 jobs are standard
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-12 18:54:12.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/charm-jobs.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/python-jobs.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Python 3.5 jobs are standard

With upcoming cross-project goals to make testing against Python 3
mandatory for all Python-based deliverables of official projects, it
makes sense to start including the voting gate-{name}-python35
template directly in the python-jobs job-group. While at it, make
sure Python 3.4 jobs only run on branches prior to stable/newton now
that the Trusty to Xenial switch is complete.

Change-Id: I4466a9702f6d5fd5e07121d3899e5692fbe7de34
'}]
commit_message:
Python 3.5 jobs are standard

With upcoming cross-project goals to make testing against Python 3
mandatory for all Python-based deliverables of official projects, it
makes sense to start including the voting gate-{name}-python35
template directly in the python-jobs job-group. While at it, make
sure Python 3.4 jobs only run on branches prior to stable/newton now
that the Trusty to Xenial switch is complete.

Change-Id: I4466a9702f6d5fd5e07121d3899e5692fbe7de34

commit_message:
Add greater/less than tests

This patch adds tests for > and < to Jinja2 templates in Ansible. This
allows them to be easily used with filters like select or selectattr:

  vehicles | selectattr('wheels',' 'greater_than', 4)

Change-Id: I3dc057f121ff5548a9820728a6ff0258be5d7738

subject: Add python3-dev to bindep and use py27for some envs
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-12-12 18:15:02.000000000', 'files': ['bindep.txt', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Add python3-dev to bindep and use py27for some envs

Installed my workstation with Ubuntu Xenial and then hit a few
snags running tox.

python3-dev is needed to build the python3 envs. Did not actually
test python3-devel (rpm) as I don't have such a system.

While python2.7 is the default, tox (on Xenial) itself uses
python3.5, hence 3.5 becomes the basepython and a number
of envs don't work.

Driveby, removed warning about /bin/echo in py3pep8

Change-Id: Ie880246dd757570b8e444da0e643f3c50093bdc5
"}]
commit_message:
Add python3-dev to bindep and use py27for some envs

Installed my workstation with Ubuntu Xenial and then hit a few
snags running tox.

python3-dev is needed to build the python3 envs. Did not actually
test python3-devel (rpm) as I don't have such a system.

While python2.7 is the default, tox (on Xenial) itself uses
python3.5, hence 3.5 becomes the basepython and a number
of envs don't work.

Driveby, removed warning about /bin/echo in py3pep8

Change-Id: Ie880246dd757570b8e444da0e643f3c50093bdc5

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-11-11 03:06:46.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/conf/ldap.py', 'releasenotes/notes/bug-1638603-354ee4167e6e.yaml', 'keystone/identity/backends/ldap/core.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_backend_ldap.py'], 'message': 'Support nested groups in Active Directory

Active Directory has a very specific mechanism to
handle nested groups.  LDAP queries need to look like this:

"(&(objectClass=group)
   (member=member:1.2.840.113556.1.4.1941:=CN=nwalnut,OU=Users,DC=EXAMPLE,DC=COM))"

If a deployment is using nested groups, three queries need to be
modified to support it:

  - list users in a group
  - list groups for a user
  - check if a user is in a group

Since all three are necessary, a single configuration value ensures
that the change is synchronized across all three calls.

(cherry picked from e8e56dc7c16b23f45eb3b041ff2b5e9c8df11f83)

Closed-Bug: #1638603
Change-Id: Ia66f81f86d7c43fbc5ba7f18ada91c77d047f7a2
'}]
commit_message:
Support nested groups in Active Directory

Active Directory has a very specific mechanism to
handle nested groups.  LDAP queries need to look like this:

"(&(objectClass=group)
   (member=member:1.2.840.113556.1.4.1941:=CN=nwalnut,OU=Users,DC=EXAMPLE,DC=COM))"

If a deployment is using nested groups, three queries need to be
modified to support it:

  - list users in a group
  - list groups for a user
  - check if a user is in a group

Since all three are necessary, a single configuration value ensures
that the change is synchronized across all three calls.

(cherry picked from e8e56dc7c16b23f45eb3b041ff2b5e9c8df11f83)

Closed-Bug: #1638603
Change-Id: Ia66f81f86d7c43fbc5ba7f18ada91c77d047f7a2

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2016-12-09 21:37:37.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/db/test_db_api.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': 'Refactor REGEX filters to eliminate 500 errors

You can currently create a 500 error on mysql by passing | as the name
filter because mysql assumes regex values are well crafted by the
application layer.

This puts in facilities to provide a safe regex filter per db engine.

It also refactors some of the inline code from _regex_instance_filter
into slightly more logical blocks, which will make it a little more
straight forward about where we need to do something smarter about
determining the dbtype in a cellsv2 world.

Change-Id: Ice2e21666905fdb76c001195e8fca21b427ea737
Closes-Bug: 1546396
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor REGEX filters to eliminate 500 errors

You can currently create a 500 error on mysql by passing | as the name
filter because mysql assumes regex values are well crafted by the
application layer.

This puts in facilities to provide a safe regex filter per db engine.

It also refactors some of the inline code from _regex_instance_filter
into slightly more logical blocks, which will make it a little more
straight forward about where we need to do something smarter about
determining the dbtype in a cellsv2 world.

Change-Id: Ice2e21666905fdb76c001195e8fca21b427ea737
Closes-Bug: 1546396

Change-Id: I5e4d169a1e6eb0e175f51943c08b025b09ffdc05
'}]
commit_message:
Use pip install rather than setup.py

pip install is greatly preferred over python setup.py install, so lets
use that to install our amphora-agent.

Change-Id: I5e4d169a1e6eb0e175f51943c08b025b09ffdc05

subject: Fix issues from new CentOS 7 release
revisions:
[{'number': 16, 'created': '2016-12-12 18:35:54.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/rhel6stig/file_perms.yml', 'tests/test.yml', 'tasks/rhel7stig/kernel.yml', 'tasks/rhel7stig/misc.yml'], 'message': 'Fix issues from new CentOS 7 release

The `systemctl status` commands now return a code of  `4` instead of `3`
when the systemd unit isn't found. This patch adds checks for those.

A packaging bug[0] causes `yum-cron` installations to fail. The
unattended upgrade tasks are now skipped for CentOS 7 until a better
workaround can be found.

The auditd daemon now resets file permissions on its log directory each
time it restarts and that breaks the idempotence tests. That task now
has "changed_when: False".

These patches should unblock the security role gate.

[0] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1293713

Change-Id: I80b66a6d9e7c8ad97761a1f890ec6a3d2db88659
'}]
commit_message:
Fix issues from new CentOS 7 release

The `systemctl status` commands now return a code of  `4` instead of `3`
when the systemd unit isn't found. This patch adds checks for those.

A packaging bug[0] causes `yum-cron` installations to fail. The
unattended upgrade tasks are now skipped for CentOS 7 until a better
workaround can be found.

The auditd daemon now resets file permissions on its log directory each
time it restarts and that breaks the idempotence tests. That task now
has "changed_when: False".

These patches should unblock the security role gate.

[0] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1293713

Change-Id: I80b66a6d9e7c8ad97761a1f890ec6a3d2db88659

commit_message:
Use constraints for all tox environments

Infra is now ready to use constraints everywhere, adapt
the venv environment to use the default install command instead of a
specific non-constrainted install command.

With this change, now all tox environments use constraints.

Change-Id: Ibb73b4a27b5b0462a9e9f2dd80e437bcc8c7f8f4
(cherry picked from commit af13871fc8696b06c7afe66443e60192edeb70c0)

commit_message:
Allow default IPv6 route device names to have dots

When dots are used with sysctl, they are reinterpreted as slashes.
Route devices can have dots in their names, so when they are used in a
sysctl command that also uses dots, its dot will be replaced with a
slash, causing an error.

Change-Id: Ie32126a3aa8d646568d7d37ec4874419b9658935
Closes-Bug: #1627770
(cherry picked from commit b34d459bbc100e65fbc308438b3b7f72bd5fb5b6)

subject: Cleanup after any failed libvirt spawn
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-12 10:09:55.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': "Cleanup after any failed libvirt spawn

When we go to spawn a libvirt domain, we catch a few types of exceptions
and perform cleanup before failing the operation. For some reason, we
don't do this universally, which means that we leave things like network
devices laying around (from plug_vifs()). If a delete comes later, it
should clean those things up. However, if a subsequent failure prevents
that, and especially if we do a local delete at the API, we'll leak those
interfaces.

As seen in at least one real-world situation, this can cause us to leak
interfaces until we have tens of thousands of them on the system, which
then causes secondary failures.

Since we run the cleanup() routine for certain failures, it certainly
seems appropriate to run it always and not leave residue until a
successful delete is performed.

Closes-Bug: #1648840
Change-Id: Iab5afdf1b5b8d107ea0e5895c24d50712e7dc7b1
(cherry picked from commit 5e7f765266e0b94807e019b645c8be89770e7428)
"}]
commit_message:
Cleanup after any failed libvirt spawn

When we go to spawn a libvirt domain, we catch a few types of exceptions
and perform cleanup before failing the operation. For some reason, we
don't do this universally, which means that we leave things like network
devices laying around (from plug_vifs()). If a delete comes later, it
should clean those things up. However, if a subsequent failure prevents
that, and especially if we do a local delete at the API, we'll leak those
interfaces.

As seen in at least one real-world situation, this can cause us to leak
interfaces until we have tens of thousands of them on the system, which
then causes secondary failures.

Since we run the cleanup() routine for certain failures, it certainly
seems appropriate to run it always and not leave residue until a
successful delete is performed.

Closes-Bug: #1648840
Change-Id: Iab5afdf1b5b8d107ea0e5895c24d50712e7dc7b1
(cherry picked from commit 5e7f765266e0b94807e019b645c8be89770e7428)

commit_message:
Update home-page in setup.cfg

What is the problem?
The old home-page linked to http://www.openstack.org/, i think
it is not very proper. Home-page usually linked to the doc page, as
trove-dashboard does not have doc page, so i think it is proper to
change home-page to tove's doc page.

What is the solution to the problem?
Change home-page to http://docs.openstack.org/developer/trove/

Change-Id: I708a1f3ab0d131088c0197e1ef8c6cde76481125

commit_message:
Use initAction instead initScope

initScope() is deprecated in Ocata and will be removed in Queens.
So this patch changes to use initScope() to initAction().

Change-Id: I66af8b65824d224cb69004557df9f7aaf50afc72
Closes-Bug: #1647921

commit_message:
Change creation actions to global

Cluster Template creation and Cluster creation actions are batchAction.
These actions should be available from other panels. So this patch changes
these actions to globalAction.

commit_message:
Rename ObjectUpdater variables in unit test to appropriate names

There are ObjectUpdater variables named 'cu' in unit test.
Since the variables seems to have ContainerUpdater objects, the names
lessen readability of the unit test codes.

This patch changes the varibale names to 'ou' for readability.

Change-Id: Iabdd7d8e7f0648b10000eabce2ee2e3cf385d43e

Since the integer IDs for custom resource classes are generated in code,
there is the possibility of a race condition when adding more than one
such class in a short period of time. This patch adds a loop to catch
the specific exception in this case, so that it can be retried.

Blueprint: custom-resource-classes

Change-Id: I15ad20333fb9724224bcb96427e0819ab5efd5bd
'}]
commit_message:
Add a retry loop to ResourceClass creation

Since the integer IDs for custom resource classes are generated in code,
there is the possibility of a race condition when adding more than one
such class in a short period of time. This patch adds a loop to catch
the specific exception in this case, so that it can be retried.

Blueprint: custom-resource-classes

Change-Id: I15ad20333fb9724224bcb96427e0819ab5efd5bd

commit_message:
Install required apt packages for pip builds

Since https://review.openstack.org/#/c/409468/ we need to install the
required apt packages needed to build pip packages. These are already
present on repo_servers but in the centralised role testing we don't use
a repo_server.

commit_message:
Correct use of reserved_host_memory{_mb}

The charm templates use the invalid configuration option:

 reserved_host_memory

to configure the reserved memory for a compute host; update
this to:

 reserved_host_memory_mb

to ensure that memory gets correctly reserved for the host.

Change-Id: I7b8089b165fddc023305ee37efe95e571e8d2407
Closes-Bug: #1646657

commit_message:
Limit jobs for Cinder driverfixes branch

The driverfixes/* branches will be used to provide a place for
vendor bug fix backports that do not meet stable policy, and as
such testing for these patches will be on the driver vendors to
ensure they should be made available to their customers.

This filters defined Cinder jobs to only run pep8 tests against
these branches.

Change-Id: Id45eace06ef576199a7fe6287fe7ef021cb52828

subject: Handle cinder driverfixes branch (part1)
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-12-11 20:04:00.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Handle cinder driverfixes branch (part1)

The driverfixes/* branches will be used to provide a place for vendor
bug fix backports that do not meet stable policy, and as such testing
for these patches will be on the driver vendors to ensure they should be
made available to their customers. This filters defined Cinder jobs to
only run pep8 and releasenotes tests against these branches.

The releasenotes test is only run if releasenotes are changed and should
stay to not get broken releasenotes in.

Part 1: Handle all jobs that are specific to cinder.

These jobs are run in check/gate queue for cinder and are handled
explicitly by this change:

* gate-cinder-pep8-ubuntu-trusty
* gate-cinder-pep8-ubuntu-xenial

* gate-cinder-tox-compliance-ubuntu-xenial
* cinder-* post jobs

Changes like hese are ubuntu-trusty-jobs that will only run on
stable/mitaka and stable/liberty, thus never on driverfixes:
* gate-cinder-python27-db-ubuntu-trusty
* gate-grenade-dsvm-neutron-ubuntu-trusty
* gate-tempest-dsvm-full-devstack-plugin-ceph-ubuntu-trusty

* gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full-ubuntu-trusty

* gate-tempest-dsvm-full-bdd-nv
* gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-identity-v3-only-full-ubuntu-xenial-nv

Change-Id: Ia88441b437efeda388c00678ebcc72bca15d45fb
Co-Authored-By: Sean McGinnis <sean_mcginnis@dell.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Handle cinder driverfixes branch (part1)

The driverfixes/* branches will be used to provide a place for vendor
bug fix backports that do not meet stable policy, and as such testing
for these patches will be on the driver vendors to ensure they should be
made available to their customers. This filters defined Cinder jobs to
only run pep8 and releasenotes tests against these branches.

The releasenotes test is only run if releasenotes are changed and should
stay to not get broken releasenotes in.

Part 1: Handle all jobs that are specific to cinder.

These jobs are run in check/gate queue for cinder and are handled
explicitly by this change:

* gate-cinder-pep8-ubuntu-trusty
* gate-cinder-pep8-ubuntu-xenial
* gate-cinder-docs-ubuntu-xenial
* gate-cinder-pep8-ubuntu-xenial
* gate-cinder-python27-db-ubuntu-xenial
* gate-cinder-python34-db
* gate-cinder-python35-db
* gate-cinder-requirements
* gate-cinder-tox-compliance-ubuntu-xenial
* cinder-* post jobs

Changes like hese are ubuntu-trusty-jobs that will only run on
stable/mitaka and stable/liberty, thus never on driverfixes:
* gate-cinder-python27-db-ubuntu-trusty
* gate-grenade-dsvm-neutron-ubuntu-trusty
* gate-tempest-dsvm-full-devstack-plugin-ceph-ubuntu-trusty
* gate-grenade-dsvm-cinder-multinode-ubuntu-trusty
* gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full-ubuntu-trusty
* gate-rally-dsvm-cinder-ubuntu-trusty-nv
* etc.

Handled elsewhere:
* gate-cinder-api-ref (only runs on master)

These changes are not yet handled:
* gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full-ubuntu-xenial
* gate-grenade-dsvm-neutron-ubuntu-xenial
* gate-tempest-dsvm-full-devstack-plugin-ceph-ubuntu-xenial
* gate-grenade-dsvm-cinder-multinode-ubuntu-xenial
* gate-rally-dsvm-cinder-ubuntu-xenial-nv
* gate-cinder-dsvm-apache-ubuntu-xenial-nv
* gate-tempest-dsvm-full-sheepdog-ubuntu-xenial-nv
* gate-tempest-dsvm-full-drbd-devstack-ubuntu-xenial-nv
* gate-tempest-dsvm-full-lio-ubuntu-xenial
* gate-tempest-dsvm-full-bdd-nv
* gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-identity-v3-only-full-ubuntu-xenial-nv

Change-Id: Ia88441b437efeda388c00678ebcc72bca15d45fb
Co-Authored-By: Sean McGinnis <sean_mcginnis@dell.com>

commit_message:
Reducing a few minutes from the job timeout to save the logs

We are reducing from the DEVSTACK_GATE_TIMEOUT 13 minutes in order to
be able to collect the logs from all the nodes and upload it.

Change-Id: Ia7d2cf622899a29a1ab31f548e6417d3fdfcd223
Closes-Bug: #1618003

should also be the default in tripleo, to keep in sync with other
openstack projects, like tempest.

commit_message:
api-ref: note that os-virtual-interfaces is nova-network only

Let's avoid confusion over errors from the os-virtual-interfaces
exception when using Neutron and make a note that it's only
implemented for nova-network.

Change-Id: I7a136eecbeb5f89dfe98f51abf1188213bdca9fd
Closes-Bug: #1648047

commit_message:
beaker: make sure we remove EPEL

EPEL seems to be installed on centos7 images in OpenStack Infra. This
patch makes sure we remove EPEL, like we already do in
puppet-openstack-integration.

Change-Id: I898ed20f3d27a6d23763f8d7f97d0ad348187e93

commit_message:
Add /etc/environment to systemd unit

To use default environment variable such as HTTP,HTTPS and NO proxy
This fix the curling of etcd.discovery.io failing when initiated by
magnum-conductor

Closes-Bug: #1648530
Change-Id: Iaed5d7446f50874e265b7e62a5ac9935ec815e52
(cherry picked from commit 6572f04a138722926bd3b57f1c365e77bea6d354)

commit_message:
[Devstack] Use openstack CLI instead of other clients

Switch manila devstack plugin for usage of only openstack client,
because other CLIs (such as neutron [1]) "are"/"going to be" deprecated
in favor of openstack client.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/243348/

Change-Id: If06dfc2c79df4628e747ac28d0add8d4a223777c
Closes-Bug: #1644589

commit_message:
Remove manual handling of old context variables

In later versions of oslo.context the from_environ method will pick up
these variables [1] so we don't need to handle them manually here.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.context/blob/2.9.0/oslo_context/context.py#L51

Change-Id: Ie0634695ae3e5503f1853f428542827b0264cfe3

When an attempt is made to delete a resource class that is used for
existing Inventory, an exception is raised. This change adds the name of
the resource class to the error message, making it a little more
informative to the user.

Blueprint: custom-resource-classes

Change-Id: Id482ccaec3b1916780782164aa3c9e84a8521177
'}]
commit_message:
Improve the error message for failed RC deletion

When an attempt is made to delete a resource class that is used for
existing Inventory, an exception is raised. This change adds the name of
the resource class to the error message, making it a little more
informative to the user.

Blueprint: custom-resource-classes

Change-Id: Id482ccaec3b1916780782164aa3c9e84a8521177

commit_message:
Make nova.tests.unit.virt pass with CONF.use_neutron=True by default

The main issue here was if you don't stub out the os-vif plugging
in the libvirt driver, the test_virt_drivers tests will try to
actually execute commands on the system.

Part of blueprint use-neutron-by-default

Change-Id: Iabfc1809d302b80cf4674155feaa0abb61ca8dcb

commit_message:
Make xenapi tests work with CONF.use_neutron=True by default

The main issue in the xenapi unit tests was faking out network_info
to be an unrealistic string, it must be a list of dicts. There was
also a neutron-specific test which wasn't actually running against
neutron before this, so this fixes that test to behave properly.

Part of blueprint use-neutron-by-default

Change-Id: I3a817ada790b9aa827c7844a2e249dd061ed3936

set use_neutron=False to pass for when CONF.use_neutron is set to
True by default.

Part of blueprint use-neutron-by-default

commit_message:
neutron: handle no_allocate in create_pci_requests_for_sriov_ports

If the server create request is specifically requesting that
networks aren't allocated for the instance, then we should
short-circuit on that in create_pci_requests_for_sriov_ports.

In the case of no_allocate, the NetworkRequestList is not empty,
it has a single NetworkRequest entry, but it's the 'none' value
which is treated special.

Change-Id: I740c49111bc8e5e76a2fe42b35e8d6c9267e04a2

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12898, 'name': 'Tony Breeds', 'email': 'tony@bakeyournoodle.com', 'username': 'tonyb'}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-07 09:26:00.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/compute/hypervisors.py', 'nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_hypervisors.py'], 'message': "Handle ComputeHostNotFound when listing hypervisors

Compute node resources must currently be deleted manually
in the database, and as such they can reference service
records which have been deleted via the services delete API.
Because of this when listing hypervisors (compute nodes), we
may get a ComputeHostNotFound error when trying to lookup a
service record for a compute node where the service was
deleted. This causes the API to fail with a 500 since it's not
handled.

This change handles the ComputeHostNotFound when looping over
compute nodes in the hypervisors index and detail methods and
simply ignores them.

Change-Id: I2717274bb1bd370870acbf58c03dc59cee30cc5e
Closes-Bug: #1646255
(cherry picked from commit f0d44c5b09f3f3c84038d40b621bb629a1f8110e)
"}]
commit_message:
Handle ComputeHostNotFound when listing hypervisors

Compute node resources must currently be deleted manually
in the database, and as such they can reference service
records which have been deleted via the services delete API.
Because of this when listing hypervisors (compute nodes), we
may get a ComputeHostNotFound error when trying to lookup a
service record for a compute node where the service was
deleted. This causes the API to fail with a 500 since it's not
handled.

This change handles the ComputeHostNotFound when looping over
compute nodes in the hypervisors index and detail methods and
simply ignores them.

Change-Id: I2717274bb1bd370870acbf58c03dc59cee30cc5e
Closes-Bug: #1646255
(cherry picked from commit f0d44c5b09f3f3c84038d40b621bb629a1f8110e)

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-12-02 03:06:15.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_resource_tracker.py', 'nova/compute/resource_tracker.py'], 'message': 'Correct the sorting of datetimes for migrations

In commit e5269b3a8f95c41283a9e6109835142586fe62a6, the code to compare
the updated_at times for different migration objects was changed to make
it Python3 compatible. However, there was a logical error introduced,
whereby migrations with a value of None for their updated_at attribute
were considered as more recent than those with actual values. This fixes
that logic so that None values always sort as older than actual values.

Closes-Bug: #1611458

Change-Id: If4feceb9e385f962fdf690f3ed62f63a19c61d7d
'}]
commit_message:
Correct the sorting of datetimes for migrations

In commit e5269b3a8f95c41283a9e6109835142586fe62a6, the code to compare
the updated_at times for different migration objects was changed to make
it Python3 compatible. However, there was a logical error introduced,
whereby migrations with a value of None for their updated_at attribute
were considered as more recent than those with actual values. This fixes
that logic so that None values always sort as older than actual values.

Closes-Bug: #1611458

Change-Id: If4feceb9e385f962fdf690f3ed62f63a19c61d7d

commit_message:
Show team and repo badges on README

This patch adds the team's and repository's badges to the README file.
The motivation behind this is to communicate the project status and
features at first glance.

For more information about this effort, please read this email thread:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-October/105562.html

subject: Fix default IPv6 BGP peer for BIRD
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-09 16:03:34.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/inventory/group_vars/neutron_calico_dhcp_agent.yml'], 'message': 'Fix default IPv6 BGP peer for BIRD

The jinja calculation of the BIRD BGP peer was failing intermittently
when IPv6 connectivity was not present.

Even though the IPv6 deployment was being detected correctly as
disabled by the role, the configuration task was failing to skip
consistently because the IPv6 peer address var could not be
resolved by Jinja.

This fixes the default IPv6 peer calculation to resolve to an empty
string when no IPv6 connectivity is present, which allows the
automatic IPv6 detection to skip the config task.

Change-Id: If450b237ba349a163f44f40b945c98b14c9d7042
(cherry picked from commit 61f5526945cd2f36b6e5c8a1f9eeba664a1a58d4)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix default IPv6 BGP peer for BIRD

The jinja calculation of the BIRD BGP peer was failing intermittently
when IPv6 connectivity was not present.

Even though the IPv6 deployment was being detected correctly as
disabled by the role, the configuration task was failing to skip
consistently because the IPv6 peer address var could not be
resolved by Jinja.

This fixes the default IPv6 peer calculation to resolve to an empty
string when no IPv6 connectivity is present, which allows the
automatic IPv6 detection to skip the config task.

Change-Id: If450b237ba349a163f44f40b945c98b14c9d7042
(cherry picked from commit 61f5526945cd2f36b6e5c8a1f9eeba664a1a58d4)

subject: Fix cluster relation unnecessary service restarts
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-07 12:05:04.000000000', 'files': ['unit_tests/test_cinder_utils.py', 'hooks/cinder_utils.py'], 'message': 'Fix cluster relation unnecessary service restarts

The logic introduced in commit 619ce065 to formalise database
initialisation did not support the leader switching and re-runs
of the shared-db relation. This resulted in extraneous service
restarts. We avoid this by adding some extra logic around this
code.

Closes-Bug: 1561927
(cherry picked from commit 1e1000a0892046b158e104025b04d3cf53a2a1b8)
Change-Id: If988331e552da930eff868abded323014fd50f04
'}]
commit_message:
Fix cluster relation unnecessary service restarts

The logic introduced in commit 619ce065 to formalise database
initialisation did not support the leader switching and re-runs
of the shared-db relation. This resulted in extraneous service
restarts. We avoid this by adding some extra logic around this
code.

Closes-Bug: 1561927
(cherry picked from commit 1e1000a0892046b158e104025b04d3cf53a2a1b8)
Change-Id: If988331e552da930eff868abded323014fd50f04

commit_message:
Fix main public interface name not always be eth0.

I found that in Xenial. The main public interface name is not
always be eth0. So role bootstrap-host have to change from eth0 to
ansible_default_ipv4.interface to get the correct default
public interface name

Change-Id: Iab26e48010b57240110e5235dd059622dd8057cd
Closes-Bug: #1647107

commit_message:
Stop telling users to check logs

End users do not have access to operator service logs. If there is a
problem creating a volume or a volume backup, telling them to check the
logs is just rude.

Change-Id: I16aeb4be16c1f43e19f24dc4dc935958a7523b9c

subject: Fix exception due to BDM race in get_available_resource()
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10135, 'name': 'Lee Yarwood', 'display_name': 'Lee Yarwood', 'email': 'lyarwood@redhat.com', 'username': 'lyarwood'}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 21784, 'name': 'Radek Zetik', 'email': 'radekx.zetik@intel.com', 'username': 'rzetikx'}, {'_account_id': 22017, 'name': 'shiliang', 'email': 'shiliang@chinac.com', 'username': 'shiliang1'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-01 16:01:06.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': 'Fix exception due to BDM race in get_available_resource()

If we run the resource tracker periodic at the right time, we
may try to collect BDM info from a newly-created instance before
we have any BDM records for it. This patch excludes instances
that have no reported BDMs to avoid choking there. This also
adds a test which simulates an instance that is partially in
the database, but is not fully created.

Closes-Bug: #1602057
(cherry picked from commit 66246c4c9b6f766f40ee922c38c46f35bb02ae70)
(cherry picked from commit 73e17c3c2e3041aaaff43896c023d1a63cd0ce1f)
Change-Id: I12c9c1ae6ca27727e8742060647dbe7017cded08
'}]
commit_message:
Fix exception due to BDM race in get_available_resource()

If we run the resource tracker periodic at the right time, we
may try to collect BDM info from a newly-created instance before
we have any BDM records for it. This patch excludes instances
that have no reported BDMs to avoid choking there. This also
adds a test which simulates an instance that is partially in
the database, but is not fully created.

Closes-Bug: #1602057
(cherry picked from commit 66246c4c9b6f766f40ee922c38c46f35bb02ae70)
(cherry picked from commit 73e17c3c2e3041aaaff43896c023d1a63cd0ce1f)
Change-Id: I12c9c1ae6ca27727e8742060647dbe7017cded08

commit_message:
Not allow overcommit ratios to be negative

Currently the three overcommit ratios: ram_allocation_ratio,
cpu_allocation_ratio, and disk_allocation_ratio can be set to negative values.
It's up to the scheduler filters to impose the checks on these ratios.

It makes more sense to make sure these 3 ratios are not negative when
nova-compute is started.  If any of these ratios is negative then nova-compute
service will fail to start.

Closes-Bug: #1604116
Change-Id: Ic960e319b59910c0178e81259b2e35435f2db592
(cherry picked from commit fcf2a644fbe6efc2bfd2810add36a099cadd959e)

As part of the Trusty removal, the "pattern:" option for service
restarts can be removed. This prevents the following warning message

[WARNING]: Ignoring "pattern" as it is not used in "systemd"

Change-Id: I38e04f48360ef558fa7d99e90fb0e73a9cb887be
'}]
commit_message:
Remove pattern reference in service restart

As part of the Trusty removal, the "pattern:" option for service
restarts can be removed. This prevents the following warning message
from appearing in the Ansible runs:

[WARNING]: Ignoring "pattern" as it is not used in "systemd"

Change-Id: I38e04f48360ef558fa7d99e90fb0e73a9cb887be

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-12-02 14:17:02.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/process.rst'], 'message': 'Some improvement to the process doc

While doing a close read of the process doc, some issues were found
which this changeset tried to address:

* a variety of minor typos and grammatical issues
* resources that could have better links
* time/cycle dependent links and discussion that could be improved
  by either changing the name of the cycle, making the statements
  historical, or otherwise tweaking for some clarity

The changes are certainly not complete, but hopefully a useful
improvement.

Change-Id: I463bdf97154a5d7b241e8c11955ddbcac5804f8a
'}]
commit_message:
Some improvement to the process doc

While doing a close read of the process doc, some issues were found
which this changeset tried to address:

* a variety of minor typos and grammatical issues
* resources that could have better links
* time/cycle dependent links and discussion that could be improved
  by either changing the name of the cycle, making the statements
  historical, or otherwise tweaking for some clarity

The changes are certainly not complete, but hopefully a useful
improvement.

Change-Id: I463bdf97154a5d7b241e8c11955ddbcac5804f8a

subject: Update openvswitch restart for suse
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-09 00:30:22.000000000', 'files': ['lib/neutron_plugins/ovs_base'], 'message': 'Update openvswitch restart for suse

Starting with SLE12 SP2 and with openSUSE Leap the distro-shipped
openvswitch is the normal systemd openvswitch.service service file
and no longer the older openvswitch-switch Sysv5 init script. Add
a special case for that.

Change-Id: I5152f2585c3d4d18853988d6290039d6b1713b99
'}]
commit_message:
Update openvswitch restart for suse

Starting with SLE12 SP2 and with openSUSE Leap the distro-shipped
openvswitch is the normal systemd openvswitch.service service file
and no longer the older openvswitch-switch Sysv5 init script. Add
a special case for that.

Change-Id: I5152f2585c3d4d18853988d6290039d6b1713b99

subject: Increase undercloud ssh timeout from 5 to 10 minutes
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8652, 'name': 'Attila Darazs', 'email': 'adarazs@redhat.com', 'username': 'adarazs'}, {'_account_id': 10022, 'name': 'Gabriele Cerami', 'email': 'gcerami@redhat.com', 'username': 'panda'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 12715, 'name': 'John Trowbridge', 'email': 'trown@redhat.com', 'username': 'trown'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-12 14:33:43.000000000', 'files': ['roles/libvirt/setup/undercloud/tasks/main.yml'], 'message': 'Increase undercloud ssh timeout from 5 to 10 minutes

I encountered an error during a quickstart run twice in succession --
time out on waiting for undercloud VM ssh to become available. I managed
to log in just fine via `ssh -i $WORKDIR/id_rsa_undercloud
root@$UNDERCLOUD_IP`. This makes me think that the timeout of 5 minutes
might be just a bit too short for some environments. Doubling the
timeout to 10 minutes got quickstart past this step on my environment.

Change-Id: I1a74d996579368cbffa2dfb3a9cab45c0f365a5e
Closes-Bug: #1649272
'}]
commit_message:
Increase undercloud ssh timeout from 5 to 10 minutes

I encountered an error during a quickstart run twice in succession --
time out on waiting for undercloud VM ssh to become available. I managed
to log in just fine via `ssh -i $WORKDIR/id_rsa_undercloud
root@$UNDERCLOUD_IP`. This makes me think that the timeout of 5 minutes
might be just a bit too short for some environments. Doubling the
timeout to 10 minutes got quickstart past this step on my environment.

Change-Id: I1a74d996579368cbffa2dfb3a9cab45c0f365a5e
Closes-Bug: #1649272

subject: Fix changing of dimensions in aggregator
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-12-09 21:50:46.000000000', 'files': ['monasca_agent/common/aggregator.py'], 'message': 'Fix changing of dimensions in aggregator

The aggregator will change the dimension dictionary that is
passed in if it needs to add device_name or hostname. This is
an unexpected behavior when submitting a metric from a
check plugin. Changing to grabbing a copy of the dimension dictionary

Change-Id: I0df7b20bbf194a3ea6e2b0390d25adfd66b7e6d4
'}]
commit_message:
Fix changing of dimensions in aggregator

The aggregator will change the dimension dictionary that is
passed in if it needs to add device_name or hostname. This is
an unexpected behavior when submitting a metric from a
check plugin. Changing to grabbing a copy of the dimension dictionary

Change-Id: I0df7b20bbf194a3ea6e2b0390d25adfd66b7e6d4

commit_message:
Move gateway ping to connectivity tests

Gateway ping is actually function of connectivity checker, not netconfig
one, so it should be moved from there. Also it breaks the case when
netconfig tasks ran on bootstrap node for network verification graph
when there is no default gateway yet.

Change-Id: I8c5fbd1b78eeb0abbae57c66a5b0c1d17b81fad2
(cherry picked from commit 660d98018455aa53f56d1946a39be8fa1364f8a2)
Closes-Bug: #1624288

commit_message:
Fix bug when using multiple DeployArtifactURLs

The script tries to download all artifact URLs with a single
request, instead of downloading each URL on its own if
multiple DeployArtifactURLs were given.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-12-09 21:18:33.000000000', 'files': ['nova/pci/manager.py', 'nova/tests/unit/pci/test_manager.py'], 'message': 'Fix crashing during guest config with pci_devices=None

The Instance.pci_devices field is nullable, but the get_instance_pci_devs()
function does not account for that. If it is passed an instance (from an
older deployment) with no pci_devices, it will crash trying to iterate
None as a list.

Change-Id: I3d535e01ac31db7804347c3938c0d88a28ba67f5
Closes-Bug: #1648887
'}]
commit_message:
Fix crashing during guest config with pci_devices=None

The Instance.pci_devices field is nullable, but the get_instance_pci_devs()
function does not account for that. If it is passed an instance (from an
older deployment) with no pci_devices, it will crash trying to iterate
None as a list.

Change-Id: I3d535e01ac31db7804347c3938c0d88a28ba67f5
Closes-Bug: #1648887

commit_message:
Switch use_neutron=true by default

The old nova-network was deprecated in Newton and, according nova
release notes, no longer supported for regular deployment in Ocata.

Change the unit tests with the assumption that neutron is the default.

Change-Id: I67b23fe8797425bf47e4b2370fb82885b74318ae

commit_message:
Switch docs to use yaml with overcloud image build

The tripleo-build-images command is a much better implementation of
the image build driver. It uses yaml files to define the images in
a declartive manner, instead of imperatively in code. This patch
does so for the docs. It outlines how to use 'overcloud image build'
with that now calls tripleo-build-images.

Change-Id: I13adeb126d94dc965f58ac39cd6385872405b463

[{'number': 15, 'created': '2016-12-12 00:56:12.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'neutronclient/tests/unit/osc/test_utils.py', 'neutronclient/tests/unit/osc/v2/trunk/test_network_trunk.py', 'neutronclient/osc/v2/utils.py', 'neutronclient/osc/v2/trunk/network_trunk.py', 'neutronclient/osc/utils.py'], 'message': 'Add common utilities for OSC plugin implementation

  planned to move to osc-lib potentially
* osc/v2/utils.py for Networking v2.0 API related methods

Co-Authored-By: Yushiro FURUKAWA <y.furukawa_2@jp.fujitsu.com>

commit_message:
Add common utilities for OSC plugin implementation

This patch introduces two utility modules.
* osc/utils.py for OSC plugin general stuff which are
  planned to move to osc-lib potentially
* osc/v2/utils.py for Networking v2.0 API related methods

Co-Authored-By: Yushiro FURUKAWA <y.furukawa_2@jp.fujitsu.com>
Change-Id: Ia36687843c56ebde0d3705ef11435ec7f5cff9d8

commit_message:
Skip network verification for bonds in round robin mode

Bond interfaces with 'balance-rr' mode are now skipped by network
verification task for bootstrap nodes as network checker does not
support this type of bonding.

Change-Id: I39b2c5916fd6f39548af0e41d8e7f877983f73a2
Closes-Bug: #1546520

subject: Clean up trovestack utility (fix kick-start)
revisions:
[{'number': 21, 'created': '2016-12-12 05:39:20.000000000', 'files': ['integration/scripts/localrc.rc', 'integration/scripts/trovestack', 'integration/scripts/trovestack.rc'], 'message': "Clean up trovestack utility (fix kick-start)

With the recent changes to devstack and the migration
of the trove utility 'redstack' to 'trovestack' a number
of unnecessary items were brought over.  This change
attempts to fix some problems and clean up some issues:

 - Environment variables are ignored.
 - Credentials are taken from the clouds.yaml file or
   sourced from the devstack/accrc/{project}/{user} directory.
   This means that authentication is now done through the
   mechanism specified by devstack.
   This should fix the kick-start and clean issues.
 - The openstack client is used wherever possible with the
   same set of credentials as mentioned above.
 - References to stable/<branch> have been removed.
 - The trove devstack plugin is assumed to be in the trove repo.
 - Sourcing /tmp/integration/env.rc has been removed (items in
   this file can be moved to ~/.trovestack.options.rc if needed).
 - set_home_dir was removed.
 - The fault flavors no longer set up 'resize' versions of themselves.
 - Help for int-tests was improved to add scenario examples and
   a few other minor clarifications.

This should fix the issues people may have been having with
'kick-start' giving an authentication error after sourcing the
openrc file or 'clean' not running properly.  There should be
no more 'plugin already enabled' style errors either.

Note: The original code for switching to V3 of authentication was
removed as it wasn't an issue with kick-start/clean up per se.
It still should be fixed, but as a separate set of changes.

Change-Id: Ib9af99c37f6729e4e91114a8032732d23a3e0850
"}]
commit_message:
Clean up trovestack utility (fix kick-start)

With the recent changes to devstack and the migration
of the trove utility 'redstack' to 'trovestack' a number
of unnecessary items were brought over.  This change
attempts to fix some problems and clean up some issues:

 - Environment variables are ignored.
 - Credentials are taken from the clouds.yaml file or
   sourced from the devstack/accrc/{project}/{user} directory.
   This means that authentication is now done through the
   mechanism specified by devstack.
   This should fix the kick-start and clean issues.
 - The openstack client is used wherever possible with the
   same set of credentials as mentioned above.
 - References to stable/<branch> have been removed.
 - The trove devstack plugin is assumed to be in the trove repo.
 - Sourcing /tmp/integration/env.rc has been removed (items in
   this file can be moved to ~/.trovestack.options.rc if needed).
 - set_home_dir was removed.
 - The fault flavors no longer set up 'resize' versions of themselves.
 - Help for int-tests was improved to add scenario examples and
   a few other minor clarifications.

This should fix the issues people may have been having with
'kick-start' giving an authentication error after sourcing the
openrc file or 'clean' not running properly.  There should be
no more 'plugin already enabled' style errors either.

Note: The original code for switching to V3 of authentication was
removed as it wasn't an issue with kick-start/clean up per se.
It still should be fixed, but as a separate set of changes.

Change-Id: Ib9af99c37f6729e4e91114a8032732d23a3e0850

If a node is really slow then a single test can take longer than an
hour. It will then fail as the client it has cached will now have an
expired token. To alleviate this, the caching of the clients was removed
(since the time saved on caching the clients is probably negligible
anyway).

Checking the client code was also cleaned up for a number of tests.

The cluster tests were modified, however the code was reverted as
there is no way to test it at present (they will not run as they
haven't been modified to work with the new neutron set up).  This
will be fixed in a separate changereq (since they are currently not
being tested in the gate, this should not hold up development).

Change-Id: I63d5b78084486b806bff38068260e42128c0d0ed
Closes-Bug: 1647002
"}]
commit_message:
Stop caching client to fix long-running test fails

If a node is really slow then a single test can take longer than an
hour. It will then fail as the client it has cached will now have an
expired token. To alleviate this, the caching of the clients was removed
(since the time saved on caching the clients is probably negligible
anyway).

Checking the client code was also cleaned up for a number of tests.

The cluster tests were modified, however the code was reverted as
there is no way to test it at present (they will not run as they
haven't been modified to work with the new neutron set up).  This
will be fixed in a separate changereq (since they are currently not
being tested in the gate, this should not hold up development).

Change-Id: I63d5b78084486b806bff38068260e42128c0d0ed
Closes-Bug: 1647002

commit_message:
Network test: rework the service types/service providers tests

The test `test_service_provider` has been skip for more than 2 years
because of bug #1400370 . In the mean time, the Neutron service-type
extension has been reworked heavily.

The connection between service-types and service-providers from the
documentation PoV is briefly discussed in bug #1239153

What's left in the Neutron Core API is 'GET /service-providers'
as per the official doc here [1]

The patch adds the test for the corresponding API route.

[1] : http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/networking/v2/index.html?
expanded=list-service-providers-detail#service-providers

Related-Bug: #1400370
Change-Id: I66a077b61aa260bf0acaae1adf77f44104b67f0e

commit_message:
Move mistral for authtoken

Switch keystone_authtoken parameters for the new class
mistral::keystone::authtoken to configure the keystone_authtoken
section in mistral.conf.

Some deprecations:
- mistral::auth_uri is deprecated in favor of
  mistral::keystone::authtoken::auth_uri.
- mistral::identity_uri is deprecated in favor of
  mistral::keystone::authtoken::auth_url.
- mistral::keystone_user is deprecated in favor of
  mistral::keystone::authtoken::username.
- mistral::keystone_tenant is deprecated in favor of
  mistral::keystone::authtoken::project_name.
- mistral::keystone_password is deprecated in favor of
  mistral::keystone::authtoken::password.

Change-Id: I051f39ef6c0e78bc7dd23b6183b329e7f4d7fde8
Closes-bug: #1604463

commit_message:
Additional checks for nova scenarios

Patch adds verification of resuls of creation and list actions.
Patch contains changes in both scenarios and unit tests and affect on following
scenarios:
rally/plugins/openstack/scenarios/nova/aggregates.create_and_list_aggregates
rally/plugins/openstack/scenarios/nova/flavors.create_and_list_flavors
rally/plugins/openstack/scenarios/nova/floating_ips_bulk.create_and_list_floating_ips_bulk
rally/plugins/openstack/scenarios/nova/keypairs.create_and_list_keypairs
rally/plugins/openstack/scenarios/nova/networks.create_and_list_networks
rally/plugins/openstack/scenarios/nova/security_group.create_and_list_secgroups
rally/plugins/openstack/scenarios/nova/servers.create_and_list_server

Files 'nova.utils' and 'rally.task.functional' (including unit tests) were also modified

Change-Id: Ie17c9127a5a3bab499714f20ddbc7ab08b8dd45b

commit_message:
Enables Ubuntu Xenial release (16.04)

- replaces ubuntu14 with ubuntu16
- style fixes to make rubocop happy
- converts smoke tests to python-openstackclient
- tweaks memory limits for multi_node
- corrects ethernet interface naming
- prunes misleading pre-provisioning environment files
- uses atlas for vagrant images
- makes the destroy_all recipe work again

Change-Id: I79aa5f793614f5430c613dc0b2fc241434fde1f9
Implements: blueprint newton-xenial

commit_message:
Allow 'get_all_class_names' to pass kwargs

The keyword arguments fully_qualified and truncate_builtins
are useful to allow to be passed, and are meaningful to pass
along from this function to the `get_class_name` function so
let them be passed.

Change-Id: I0787bbaf209f3c223e72214d63e006cfc1d40866

commit_message:
Change network allocation of Unity driver to 1

One IP port is enough for share server created on Unity system.
This patch change the IP allocation in Unity driver from 2 to 1.

Change-Id: I3e8ea3f5fe1d3e713239d5c0fb19733abc97f5bd
Closes-Bug: 1648328

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 11022, 'name': 'Rodrigo Duarte Sousa', 'email': 'rodrigodsousa@gmail.com', 'username': 'rodrigods'}, {'_account_id': 18338, 'name': 'Ron De Rose', 'email': 'ronald.de.rose@intel.com', 'username': 'derosenet'}, {'_account_id': 18464, 'name': 'Richard Avelar', 'email': 'csravelar@gmail.com', 'username': 'razone'}, {'_account_id': 21420, 'name': 'Gage Hugo', 'email': 'gagehugo@gmail.com', 'username': 'ghugo'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-12-08 22:57:53.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/token/providers/common.py'], 'message': 'Remove exception from v2 validation path

In the process of refactoring most of the token provider API, I
proposed a patch that would raise an exception if a v2.0 token was
validated to prove nothing in keystone was currently validating v2.0
tokens. This commit removes the exception from the v2.0 validation
path because we will need to be able to validate v2.0 token during
and upgrade from Newton to Ocata.

The shim should remain in the token provider through-out the Ocata
release, but it can be removed as soon as Pike opens for development.
When deployments upgrade from Ocata to Pike, hopefully deployments
will no longer have any v2.0 tokens and they will all be considered
expired anyway.

Change-Id: I1e50aadee45e16b7bad64de446a6e66c6ad237da
'}]
commit_message:
Remove exception from v2 validation path

In the process of refactoring most of the token provider API, I
proposed a patch that would raise an exception if a v2.0 token was
validated to prove nothing in keystone was currently validating v2.0
tokens. This commit removes the exception from the v2.0 validation
path because we will need to be able to validate v2.0 token during
and upgrade from Newton to Ocata.

The shim should remain in the token provider through-out the Ocata
release, but it can be removed as soon as Pike opens for development.
When deployments upgrade from Ocata to Pike, hopefully deployments
will no longer have any v2.0 tokens and they will all be considered
expired anyway.

Change-Id: I1e50aadee45e16b7bad64de446a6e66c6ad237da

commit_message:
Added conditional headers to HEAD request documentation

Currently, conditional headers, e.g. If-Match, If-Modified-Since, etc.,
are listed for the GET objects API call, but not in the HEAD objects
call in the api-ref documentation.  This patch adds the missing headers
to the HEAD documentation.

Change-Id: Idd1c248cc27415d148a1b9a5eb2e95f25b8c4da0
Closes-Bug: #1630212

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-14 11:17:14.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3/ha_router.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_ha_router.py'], 'message': 'Remove floatingip address ignores ha_state

We both enables router_distributed and l3_ha in server side,
and configures L3 agent node as dvr_snat in compute nodes.
HA router removing floatingip address only in master node,
and dvr local router only remove FIP rule. This will cause
RTNETLINK error if we operates floatingip "associate --> disassociate
--> reassociate".

This patch removes floatingip address whether router's ha_state
is master or backup.
Another solution is adding remove_floating_ip in dvr_edge_router.

Change-Id: I2fab45cff786c475d69c5f0cf4e9b71e6bbbe653
Closes-Bug: #1641535
'}]
commit_message:
Remove floatingip address ignores ha_state

We both enables router_distributed and l3_ha in server side,
and configures L3 agent node as dvr_snat in compute nodes.
HA router removing floatingip address only in master node,
and dvr local router only remove FIP rule. This will cause
RTNETLINK error if we operates floatingip "associate --> disassociate
--> reassociate".

This patch removes floatingip address whether router's ha_state
is master or backup.
Another solution is adding remove_floating_ip in dvr_edge_router.

Change-Id: I2fab45cff786c475d69c5f0cf4e9b71e6bbbe653
Closes-Bug: #1641535
